PR or upgrade to it yourself)\n- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it OutOfMemoryError.\r\nPdfSmartCopy has a limit of 100 recursive levels, but it run all 100 levels, \r\nWith this change, when the limit is reached the \"smart\" copy is aborted for that object and normal copy is used.\r\nProvided a tests case and a sample \"broken\" pdf example file.\r\nWithout the patch, the pdfsmartcopy takes some minutes, with the patch it only takes a few seconds.\r\n\r\n## password based AES256 (ISO 32000-2) support, see issue #375","body":"## Description of the new Feature\r\n\r\nSupport for PDF encryption using AES256 has been specified twice, first by Adobe in their developer extensions to ISO 32000-1, and later again in ISO 32000-2. The former variant is associated with the standard security handler revision *5* in the encryption dictionary, the latter variant with revision *6*.\r\n\r\nThis pull request implements support for the latter variant, *R = 6*, in the context of password encryption. It does _not_ add support for *R = 5*. Furthermore, providing support for AES256 in the context of certificate encryption was not an objective.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #375 \r\n\r\n@Lonzak helped a lot by testing and providing example files.\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature\r\n\r\n### DecryptAES256R6Test\r\n\r\nThis class tests the OpenPDF decryption feature for AES256 encrypted files according to ISO 32000-2, i.e. for <code>R = 6<\/code>.\r\n\r\nThe test files were associated with issue #375, examples for stackoverflow.com issues, or provided by @Lonzak.\r\n\r\n### EncryptAES256R6Test\r\n\r\nThis class tests the OpenPDF encryption feature for AES256 encrypted files according to ISO 32000-2, i.e. for <code>R = 6<\/code>.\r\n\r\nBoth creation of a new encrypted PDF from scratch and stamping of an existing encrypted PDF are tested.\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\n\r\nSome additional public constants in `PdfEncryption`, `PdfName`, `PdfWriter`.\r\n\r\nAdditional member variables in `PdfEncryption`.\r\n\r\nThese changes are unlikely to cause issues except with other OpenPDF patches changing encryption The supplied _Phrase()_ is not being rendered.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nDocument document = new Document( PageSize.Letter );\r\nPdfWriter.getInstance( document, new FileOutputStream( \"/tmp/output.pdf\" ) );\r\n\r\n/* Set document properties */\r\ndocument.addAuthor( \"Author\" );\r\ndocument.addCreator( this.getClass().getSimpleName() );\r\ndocument.addCreationDate();\r\ndocument.addKeywords( \"some,key,words\" );\r\ndocument.addSubject( \"Subject\" );\r\ndocument.addTitle( \"Title\" );\r\ndocument.setDocumentLanguage( \"ENG\" HeaderFooter(new Phrase( \"This is a header.\", headerFont ), false );\r\nheader.setAlignment( Element.ALIGN_CENTER );\r\nheader.setBorder( Rectangle.NO_BORDER );\r\ndocument.setHeader( header );\r\n\r\n/* Footer */\r\nFont footerFont = FontFactory.getFont( FontFactory.COURIER );\r\nfooterFont.setSize( 8.0f );\r\nHeaderFooter footer = new HeaderFooter( new Phrase( \"This is a footer.\", footerFont ), false ); // does not render anything\r\n// HeaderFooter footer = new HeaderFooter( new Phrase( \"This is a footer.\", footerFont ), true ); // only page# rendered\r\nfooter.setAlignment( Element.ALIGN_CENTER );\r\nfooter.setBorder( Rectangle.NO_BORDER );\r\ndocument.setFooter( footer );\r\n\r\ndocument.open();\r\n\r\n/* Body */\r\nFont bodyFont = FontFactory.getFont( FontFactory.COURIER );\r\nbodyFont.setSize( 12.0f );\r\n\r\ndocument.add( new Paragraph( \"Hello World\", bodyFont ) );\r\ndocument.add( Chunk.NEXTPAGE );\r\ndocument.add( new Paragraph(\"Hello new page.\", bodyFont ) );\r\n\r\n/* Close */\r\ndocument.close();\r\n\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nHeader and footer _phrase_ should also render.\r\n\r\n**Screenshots**\r\n\r\n**System (please cell which sets alignment not as TOP.  After searching the codes deeper, I find it forgets to change contentHeight after modifying line.height with adding correct alignment space. In this way, I just add the missing part on contentHeight for the first line and it works perfectly!\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #747\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n```\r\npublic static void test() throws FileNotFoundException {\r\n\tDocument document = new Document(PageSize.A4);\r\n\tPdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(\"test.pdf\"));\r\n\tTable table = new Table(2);\r\n\tCell cell = new Cell(\"any text\\nany text\\nany text\\nany text\\nany text\\nany text\");\r\n\tcell.setVerticalAlignment(VerticalAlignment.BOTTOM);\r\n\ttable.addCell(cell);\r\n\tStringBuilder largeStr = new StringBuilder();\r\n\tfor (int i = 0; i < 45; i++) {\r\n\t\tlargeStr.append(String.format(\"this is to test-> row %d\\n\", i));\r\n\t}\r\n\tCell cell2 = new Cell(new Phrase(largeStr.toString()));\r\n\ttable.addCell(cell2);\r\n\tdocument.open();\r\n\tdocument.add(table);\r\n\tdocument.close();\r\n}\r\n```\r\n### Before fixing:\r\n<img width=\"234\" alt=\"image\" monospaced font mapping on Windows and Linux","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nThe `DefaultFontMapper` attempts to map awt font to PDF fonts. Even if the `Graphics2D` code explicitly sets the font to `Font.MONOSPACED` the font might get converted to a different font family in the `CompositeFontDrawer`.\r\n\r\nOn Windows it was converted to `Courier New`.\r\nOn Linux it was converted to `DejaVu San Mono`\r\n\r\nIn those cases the `HELVETICA` was used rather than `COURIER` which causes the font spacing to be incorrect on the PDF.\r\n\r\nThis PR changes to logic to catch those additional monospaced fonts out of the box without the need to create a new `FontMapper`.\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nIs anything broken because of the new code? Any changes in method signatures?\r\n\r\nThe logic changes does not affect any previous font name matches. \r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nAny other details about how to test the new feature or bugfix?\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/742/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":742,"updated_at":"2022-06-01T20:57:57Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/742/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1250864128,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/742/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/742.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/742","merged_at":"2022-06-01T16:32:15Z","diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/742.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/742"},"state_reason":null,"comments":1,"closed_at":"2022-06-01T16:32:15Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/742","labels":[],"milestone":{"creator":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"asturio","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13033226?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/asturio","site_admin":false,"id":13033226,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzMDMzMjI2","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/orgs"},"closed_at":"2022-07-09T13:25:54Z","description":null,"created_at":"2022-05-14T10:12:21Z","title":"1.3.29", com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfStamper.close(PdfStamper.java:246)\r\n    at Main.main(Main.java:68)\r\n```\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n\r\n```\r\nimport java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.IOException;\r\nimport java.util.HashMap;\r\nimport java.util.Iterator;\r\nimport java.util.Map;\r\n\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Document;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfLayer;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfStamper;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.ExceptionConverter;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfAnnotation;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfAppearance;\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * This example was written by Bruno Lowagie. It is part of the book 'iText in\r\n * Action' by Manning Publications.\r\n * ISBN: 1932394796\r\n * http://www.1t3xt.com/docs/book.php\r\n * http://www.manning.com/lowagie/\r\n */\r\n\r\npublic class Main {\r\n\r\n  public static void main(String[] args) {\r\n    System.out.println(\"-> Creates a PDF with optional content.\");\r\n    System.out.println(\"-> jars needed: OpenPDF.jar\");\r\n    System.out.println(\"-> file generated: test_layers.pdf\");\r\n    Document document = new Document();\r\n    try {\r\n      PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document,\r\n          new FileOutputStream(\"test_layers.pdf\"));\r\n      writer.setPdfVersion(PdfWriter.VERSION_1_5);\r\n      document.open();\r\n      PdfLayer layer = new PdfLayer(\"Do you seeme?\", writer);\r\n\r\n      BaseFont bf = BaseFont.createFont(BaseFont.HELVETICA,\r\n          BaseFont.WINANSI, BaseFont.NOT_EMBEDDED);\r\n      PdfContentByte cb = writer.getDirectContent();\r\n      cb.beginText();\r\n      cb.setTextMatrix(50, 790);\r\n      cb.setLeading(24);\r\n      cb.setFontAndSize(bf, 18);\r\n      cb.showText(\"Do you see me?\");\r\n      cb.beginLayer(layer);\r\n      cb.newlineShowText(\"Peek-a-Boo!!!\");\r\n      cb.endLayer();\r\n      cb.endText();\r\n      cb.sanityCheck();\r\n      document.close();\r\n\r\n    } catch (DocumentException de) {\r\n      System.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n    } catch (IOException ioe) {\r\n      System.err.println(ioe.getMessage());\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    try {\r\n      PdfReader reader;\r\n      PdfStamper stamper;\r\n      reader = new PdfReader(\"test_layers.pdf\");\r\n      stamper = new PdfStamper(reader, new FileOutputStream(\"test_layers_disabled.pdf\"));\r\n      System.out.println(stamper.getPdfLayers());\r\n      stamper.close();\r\n    } catch (IOException e) {\r\n      e.printStackTrace();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Expected 720: Fixed Null Pointer Exception","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nPrevents NullPointerException on some PDFs\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #720 \r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nI don't think so. I created breakpoint at `PdfArray kidsPR = page.getAsArray(PdfName.KIDS);`\r\nand when `PdfDictionary page` was null I forced a return, so that the programm wouldn't hit the when opening PDF file with invalid indirect reference","body":"I have a (confidential) PDF file, which can be opened by Acrobat Reader, Chrome and Firefox, but throws the following exception when opened with OpenPDF:\r\n\r\n```\r\njava.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1\r\n\tat java.util.ArrayList.elementData(ArrayList.java:422)\r\n\tat java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:435)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.removeUnusedNode(PdfReader.java:3240)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.removeUnusedObjects(PdfReader.java:3285)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.readPdf(PdfReader.java:629)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.<init>(PdfReader.java:280)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.<init>(PdfReader.java:293)\r\n```\r\n\r\nApparently an _indirect reference_ in the PDF references a _-1_ (which is not valid according to the standard, but is ignored by most readers). I debugged the PDF and there is indeed a \"-1 0 R\" in one of the dictionary arrays, so no error in the `PRTokeniser`.\r\n\r\niText has fixed that a while ago, see here:\r\nhttps://stackoverflow.com/questions/16699709/itext-throws-java-lang-arrayindexoutofboundsexception-on-creation-of-pdfreader\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nUnfortunately I can't provide the PDF file here.\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nEither throw an InvalidPdfException or (IMHO better) silently drop the invalid and unused reference.\r\n\r\n**Version**\r\n- OpenPDF {\r\n        System.out.println(\"Parse Hello World\");\r\n\r\n        // step 1: creation of a document-object\r\n        try (Document document = new Document()) {\r\n icu4j from 70.1 to 71.1","body":"Bumps [icu4j](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu) from 70.1 to 71.1.\n<details>\n<summary>Release notes<\/summary>\n<p><em>Sourced from <a href=\"https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/releases\">icu4j's releases<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n<blockquote>\n<h2>ICU 71.1<\/h2>\n<p>We are pleased to announce the release of Unicode¬Æ ICU 71.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 updates to <a href=\"https://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-41\">CLDR 41<\/a> locale data with various additions and corrections.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 adds phrase-based line breaking for Japanese. Existing line breaking methods follow standards and conventions for body text but do not work well for short Japanese text, such as in titles and headings. This new feature is optimized for these use cases.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 adds support for Hindi written in Latin letters (<code>hi_Latn<\/code>). The CLDR data for this increasingly popular locale has been significantly revised and expanded. Note that based on user expectations, hi_Latn incorporates a large amount of English, and can also be referred to as \u201cHinglish\u201d.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 and CLDR 41 are minor releases, mostly focused on bug fixes and small enhancements. (The fall CLDR/ICU releases will update to Unicode 15 which is planned for September.) We are also working to re-establish continuous performance testing for ICU, and on development towards future versions.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 updates to the time zone data version 2022a. Note that pre-1970 data for a number of time zones has been removed, as has been the case in the upstream <a href=\"https://www.iana.org/time-zones\">tzdata<\/a> release since 2021b.<\/p>\n<p>For details, please see <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/download/71\">https://icu.unicode.org/download/71<\/a>.\nNote: Our website has moved. Please adjust your bookmarks.<\/p>\n<p>The API reference documents are published at the following location: <a href=\"https://unicode-org.github.io/icu-docs/\">https://unicode-org.github.io/icu-docs/<\/a><\/p>\n<p><em>Note: The prebuilt WinARM64 binaries below should be considered alpha/experimental.<\/em><\/p>\n<h2>ICU 71 RC<\/h2>\n<p>We are pleased to announce the release candidate for Unicode¬Æ ICU 71.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 updates to <a href=\"https://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-41\">CLDR 41<\/a> locale data with various additions and corrections, and adds phrase-based line breaking for Japanese. ICU 71 also includes a number of other bug fixes and enhancements, and we are working to re-establish continuous performance testing.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 71 updates to the time zone data version 2022a. Note that pre-1970 data for a number of time zones has been removed, as has been the case in the upstream tzdata release since 2021b.<\/p>\n<p>For details, please see <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/download/71\">https://icu.unicode.org/download/71<\/a>.\nNote: Our website has moved. Please adjust your bookmarks.<\/p>\n<p>Please test this release candidate on your platforms and report bugs and regressions by Tuesday, 2022-apr-05, via the <a href=\"http://site.icu-project.org/contacts\">icu-support mailing list<\/a>, and/or please <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/bugs\">find/submit error reports<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Please do not use this release candidate in production.<\/p>\n<p>The release candidate API reference documents are published on <a href=\"https://unicode-org.github.io/icu-docs/\">https://unicode-org.github.io/icu-docs/<\/a> \u2013 follow the \u201cDev\u201d links there.<\/p>\n<p><em>Note: The prebuilt WinARM64 binaries below should be considered alpha/experimental.<\/em><\/p>\n<\/blockquote>\n<\/details>\n<details>\n<summary>Commits<\/summary>\n<ul>\n<li>See full diff in <a href=\"https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/commits\">compare view<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<\/details>\n<br />\n\n\n[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.ibm.icu:icu4j&package-manager=maven&previous-version=70.1&new-version=71.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores)\n\nDependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.\n\n[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)\n[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)\n\n---\n\n<details>\n<summary>Dependabot commands and options<\/summary>\n<br />\n\nYou can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:\n- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR\n- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it\n- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it\n- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it\n- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging\n- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed\n- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually\n- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)\n- `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it bug: Image in footer has wrong y value","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nImage in footer will be in the top of the document.\r\n1. add a arraylist in HeaderFooter to store non-text element\r\n2. if document is creating footer, when it is about to add an image, it update text position and record non-text elements' info\r\n3. after adding boundary of footer, use flushSpecial() to draw non-text elements and their y are relative to the upper boundary of footer (ruy in Rectangle)\r\n4. considering if image is TEXTWRAP or UNDERLYING it won't occupy space but image must be under footer's upper boundary, I use padding to ensure that image won't exceed the footer boundary.  \r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #373 \r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nUnit-Tests are in FooterImageTest.java\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nNo compatibilities issues.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nTest code:\r\n```java\r\n@Test\r\npublic void centerUnderlyingPositionSceneTest() jpg.setAlignment(Image.UNDERLYING);\r\n\r\n    PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(\"testCenterPosition.pdf\"));\r\n\r\n    Paragraph footerParagraph = new Paragraph();\r\n    String test = \"This is a test line.\";\r\n    footerParagraph.add(jpg);\r\n    HeaderFooter footer = new HeaderFooter(footerParagraph, true);\r\n    footer.setAlignment(Element.ALIGN_CENTER);\r\n    document.setFooter(footer);\r\n\r\n    document.open();\r\n    document.add(new Paragraph(test));\r\n    document.close();\r\n}\r\n```\r\nBefore run direction for RTL fields","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n\r\nWe're using OpenPDF to fill out PDF forms.\r\nSome of our forms are in Hebrew (whici is an RTL language).\r\nIf the value of a field contains both LTR / RTL characters OpenPDF [always uses LTR](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/1.3.26/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/TextField.java#L211) for it.\r\nThis causes rendering issues because a single LTR character will set the run direction to LTR even if there are more Hebrew characters.\r\n\r\nThis solution adds icu4j as an optional dependecy and uses their Unicode Bidi Algorithm to check if the text is only LTR/RTL or mixed.\r\n\r\nIt seems run direction to be:\r\n\r\n* NO_BIDI in case of only LTR to preserve current behavior (not sure if this can result in different results than LTR)\r\n* RTL in case of only RTL.\r\n* In case of mixed text we choose the more abundant direction. Another approach would be to use the run direction propery of the field but I couldn't find any docs on how to find it using  OpenPDF/iText (even later versions)\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nNone.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nTry inserting these texts onto a field:\r\n\r\n```\r\n◊ê◊ó◊™ ◊©◊™◊ô◊ô◊ù ◊©◊ú◊ï◊© four five\r\nOne two ◊©◊ú◊ï◊© ◊ê◊®◊ë◊¢ ◊ó◊û◊©\r\n```\r\n\r\nIn both case their should be RTL because the Hebrew is more abundant.\r\n\r\nNote:\r\n\r\n1. We aleady use this code in our production app since yesterday. We might want to let it run for a while before adidng this to OpenPDF.\r\n2. Please keep in mind them I don't work with Java a lot and Footer definition is ignored","body":"##  Description\r\nWhen I try to define a Header and a Footer for a Document, it is not taken into account.\r\n\r\n## To Reproduce\r\nCode to reproduce the issue\r\n```java\r\nDocument document = new Document();\r\ndocument.setMargins(15f, 15f, 10f, 10f);\r\nPdfWriter.getInstance(document, output);\r\ndocument.open();\r\nHeaderFooter header = new HeaderFooter(new Phrase(\"This is a header.\"), false);\r\nHeaderFooter footer = new HeaderFooter(new Phrase(\"This is a footer \"), new Phrase(\".\"));\r\ndocument.setHeader(header);\r\ndocument.setFooter(footer);\r\ndocument.add(new Paragraph(\"Hello World\"));\r\ndocument.close();\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Expected behavior\r\nThe Header and Footer should have been added to the document.\r\n\r\n## Screenshots\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28600737/155214022-51a2c332-98b0-41ba-987a-5cf933b447da.png)\r\n\r\n## System com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfDictionary cannot be cast to class com.lowagie.text.pdf.PRIndirectReference","body":"Hello,\r\nreading a pdf file the library rises the following exception:\r\n\r\n> class com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfDictionary cannot be cast to class com.lowagie.text.pdf.PRIndirectReference \r\n\r\nI temporary solved the issue by adding to the PdfReader class the method:\r\n\r\n```\r\nprivate void iteratePages(PRIndirectReference rpage) {\r\n  PdfDictionary page = (PdfDictionary) getPdfObject(rpage);\r\n  PdfArray kidsPR = page.getAsArray(PdfName.KIDS);\r\n  // reference to a leaf\r\n  if (kidsPR == null) {\r\n    page.put(PdfName.TYPE, PdfName.PAGE);\r\n    PdfDictionary dic = pageInh.get(pageInh.size() - 1);\r\n    PdfName key;\r\n    for (Object o : dic.getKeys()) {\r\n      key = (PdfName) o;\r\n      if (page.get(key) == null)\r\n        page.put(key, dic.get(key));\r\n    }\r\n    if (page.get(PdfName.MEDIABOX) == null) {\r\n      PdfArray arr = new PdfArray(new float[] { 0, 0,\r\n              PageSize.LETTER.getRight(), PageSize.LETTER.getTop() });\r\n      page.put(PdfName.MEDIABOX, arr);\r\n    }\r\n    refsn.add(rpage);\r\n  }\r\n  // reference to a branch\r\n  else {\r\n    page.put(PdfName.TYPE, PdfName.PAGES);\r\n    pushPageAttributes(page);\r\n    for (int k = 0; k < kidsPR.size(); ++k) {\r\n      PdfObject obj = kidsPR.getPdfObject(k);\r\n      if (!obj.isIndirect()) {\r\n        while (k < kidsPR.size())\r\n          kidsPR.remove(k);\r\n        break;\r\n      }\r\n      if (obj instanceof PRIndirectReference)\r\n        iteratePages((PRIndirectReference) obj);\r\n      else if (obj instanceof PdfDictionary)\r\n        iteratePages((PdfDictionary) obj);\r\n    }\r\n    popPageAttributes();\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nprivate void iteratePages(PdfDictionary page) {\r\n  PdfArray kidsPR = page.getAsArray(PdfName.KIDS);\r\n  // reference to a leaf\r\n  if (kidsPR != null) {\r\n    page.put(PdfName.TYPE, PdfName.PAGES);\r\n    pushPageAttributes(page);\r\n    for (int k = 0; k < kidsPR.size(); ++k) {\r\n      PdfObject obj = kidsPR.getPdfObject(k);\r\n      if (!obj.isIndirect()) {\r\n        while (k < kidsPR.size())\r\n        kidsPR.remove(k);\r\n        break;\r\n      }\r\n      if (obj instanceof PRIndirectReference)\r\n        iteratePages((PRIndirectReference) obj);\r\n      else if (obj instanceof PdfDictionary)\r\n        iteratePages((PdfDictionary) obj);\r\n    }\r\n    popPageAttributes();\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nby invoking it in the method:\r\n\r\n```\r\nvoid readPages() {\r\n  if (refsn != null)\r\n    return;\r\n  refsp = null;\r\n  refsn = new ArrayList<>();\r\n  pageInh = new ArrayList<>();\r\n  PdfObject obj = reader.catalog.get(PdfName.PAGES);\r\n  if (obj instanceof PRIndirectReference)\r\n    iteratePages((PRIndirectReference) obj);\r\n  else if (obj instanceof PdfDictionary)\r\n    iteratePages((PdfDictionary) obj);\r\n  pageInh = null;\r\n  reader.rootPages.put(PdfName.COUNT, new PdfNumber(refsn.size()));\r\n}\r\n```\r\nI hope it is helpful. Could the final fix be included in one of the next releases?\r\n\r\nThanks in advance\r\n[PdfReader.java.txt](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/8116666/PdfReader.java.txt)\r\n\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/668/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":668,"updated_at":"2022-05-11T23:09:11Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/668/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1146068058,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/668/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":1,"closed_at":"2022-03-05T14:42:16Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/668","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":{"creator":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"asturio","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13033226?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/asturio","site_admin":false,"id":13033226,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzMDMzMjI2","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/orgs"},"closed_at":"2022-05-31T20:37:03Z","description":"","created_at":"2022-03-05T14:31:05Z","title":"1.3.28","closed_issues":28,"url":"https Please describe.**\r\nWhen doing a local build on a machine that doesn't have a gpg key (or a way to provide the passphrase, like an unattended build), the build fails with\r\n```\r\n[INFO] --- maven-gpg-plugin:3.0.1:sign (sign-artifacts) @ openpdf-parent ---\r\ngpg: no default secret key: No secret key\r\ngpg: signing failed: No secret key\r\n[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------\r\n[INFO] Reactor Summary for OpenPDF - Free and Open PDF 1.3.27-SNAPSHOT:\r\n[INFO] \r\n[INFO] OpenPDF - Free and Open PDF ........................ SKIPPED\r\n[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------\r\n[INFO] BUILD FAILURE\r\n[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------\r\n[INFO] Total time:  3.713 s\r\n[INFO] Finished at: 2022-01-22T10:21:29+11:00\r\n[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------\r\n[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-gpg-plugin:3.0.1:sign (sign-artifacts) on project openpdf-parent: Exit code: 2 -> [Help 1]\r\n[ERROR] \r\n[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.\r\n[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.\r\n[ERROR] \r\n[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:\r\n[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/MojoExecutionException\r\n```\r\n\r\nI think it would be useful to only require signing on release (i.e. link it to a profile that is activated by a release activity).\r\n\r\n**Describe the solution you'd like**\r\nAllow full build to pass without needing signing.\r\n\r\n**Describe alternatives you've considered**\r\nN/A.\r\n\r\n**Additional market content operators when using without properties","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nTo produce PDF/UA compatible documents artifacts needs to be marked. This can be achieved by encapsulating it with a marked content sequence under the \"Artifact\" tag. There are no further properties associated with it. When using `beginMarkedContentSequence` without a property this will result in an unbalanced market content counter `mcDepth`, whereupon an `IllegalPdfSyntaxException` will be thrown when calling `endMarkedContentSequence`.\r\nI also added the artifact tag in the PdfName class.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: # none\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nNot as far as i know. Internally there are no marked content sequences without properties used. i.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"dependabot[bot]","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/followers","type":"Bot","url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/29110?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/dependabot","site_admin":false,"id":49699333,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDM6Qm90NDk2OTkzMzM=","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/orgs"},"node_id":"PR_kwDOA8KLhc4wSoi3"},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2021-12-22T14:09:31Z","title":"PDF digital signature validation - Exception SHA1with1.2.840.10045.4.1 Signature not available","body":"\r\n**Description**\r\nHi,\r\nI have a PDF file signed with ecdsa-with-SHA1 object id: 1.2.840.10045.4.1.\r\n\r\nWhen I try to verify the digital signature with openpdf version \"1.3.26\"\r\nException is thrown:\r\nExceptionConverter: java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException: SHA1with1.2.840.10045.4.1 Signature not available\r\n\tat java.security.Signature.getInstance(Signature.java:228)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPKCS7.<init>(PdfPKCS7.java:544)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.AcroFields.verifySignature(AcroFields.java:2344)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.AcroFields.verifySignature(AcroFields.java:2299)\r\n\r\nBy researching the openpdf source code and online resources, I came to conclusion that latest version of\r\nopen pdf does not have a support for ecdsa-with-SHA1 object id: 1.2.840.10045.4.1\r\nhttp://oid-info.com/get/1.2.840.10045.4.1\r\n\r\nProblem is also mentioned on StackOverflow (for iText free version):\r\nhttps://stackoverflow.com/questions/46346144/digital-signature-verification-with-itext-not-working\r\n\r\nAs said on StackOverflow, when oid is added through reflection to field \"algorithmNames\" on\r\ncom.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPKCS7 class everything works.\r\nI only added this one particular oid.\r\n\r\nMy question is, is this fix valid and will this feature be added in future releases (alongside with other ECDSA oids)?\r\n\r\nThank you in advance!\r\n\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nCode to reproduce the issue (signed PDF is company legacy and currently cannot be shared)\r\n1. Sample Code\r\npackage openpdf.sample;\r\n\r\nimport java.lang.reflect.Field;\r\nimport java.security.Security;\r\nimport java.util.HashMap;\r\nimport java.util.List;\r\n\r\nimport org.bouncycastle.jce.provider.BouncyCastleProvider;\r\n\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.AcroFields;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPKCS7;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader;\r\n\r\npublic class DigitalSignatureHelper {\r\n\r\n\tprivate DigitalSignatureHelper() {\r\n\t\tthrow new IllegalStateException(\"Disallowed instantiation\");\r\n\t}\r\n\r\n\tstatic {\r\n\t\t// addOpenPdfSupportForEcdsaWithSha1(); \r\n\t}\r\n\r\n\t/**\r\n\t * When oid is added throuh reflection to field \"algorithmNames\" on\r\n\t * com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPKCS7 class everything works\r\n\t */\r\n\tprivate static void addOpenPdfSupportForEcdsaWithSha1() {\r\n\t\ttry {\r\n\t\t\tField algorithmNamesField = PdfPKCS7.class.getDeclaredField(\"algorithmNames\");\r\n\t\t\talgorithmNamesField.setAccessible(true);\r\n\r\n\t\t\t@SuppressWarnings(\"unchecked\")\r\n\t\t\tHashMap<String, String> algorithmNames = (HashMap<String, String>) algorithmNamesField.get(null);\r\n\r\n\t\t\tString oidEcdsaSha1 = \"1.2.840.10045.4.1\";\r\n\r\n\t\t\tif (algorithmNames != null && !algorithmNames.containsKey(oidEcdsaSha1)) {\r\n\t\t\t\talgorithmNames.put(oidEcdsaSha1, \"ECDSA\");\r\n\t\t\t}\r\n\r\n\t\t} catch (Exception e) {\r\n\t\t\tSystem.err.println(\"Silently reporting error\");\r\n\t\t\tSystem.err.println(e);\r\n\t\t}\r\n\t}\r\n\r\n\tpublic static void verifySignaturesOfFiles(byte[] pdfBytes, String ext) {\r\n\t\tSecurity.addProvider(new BouncyCastleProvider());\r\n\r\n\t\ttry (PdfReader pdfReader = new PdfReader(pdfBytes)) {\r\n\t\t\tAcroFields acroFields = pdfReader.getAcroFields();\r\n\t\t\tList<String> signatureNames = acroFields.getSignedFieldNames();\r\n\r\n\t\t\tfor (String name : signatureNames) {\r\n\t\t\t\tPdfPKCS7 pkcs7 = acroFields.verifySignature(name);\r\n\t\t\t\tboolean valid = pkcs7.verify();\r\n\r\n\t\t\t\tSystem.err.println(valid);\r\n\r\n\t\t\t}\r\n\t\t} catch (Exception e) {\r\n\t\t\tthrow new RuntimeException(e);\r\n\t\t}\r\n\t}\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nTo validate PDF file signed with ecdsa-with-SHA1 object id: a single table in the ColumnText in simulation mode is not taken in consideration and skiped","body":"**Bug description**\r\nin the version 1.3.26 of the lib\r\nwhen you use the ColumnText in simulation mode and you add just a single table, in case the first rows of the table has not enought space to be introduced in the simulated pdf, the table is excluded from the ColumnText calculation.\r\n\r\na simple code example\r\n```\r\nresult = ct.go(true);\r\n boolean hasText = ColumnText.hasMoreText(result); // this return false!\r\n\r\n```\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n[BUGColumnTextWihtOnlyTable.txt](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/7693213/BUGColumnTextWihtOnlyTable.txt)\r\n\r\nCode in attachment of this ticket\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nthe table cannot be excluded from the calculation in the ColumnText and the method  ColumnText.hasMoreText(result); must return false\r\n\r\n**Additional context**\r\nThe issue is anidated in the class com.lowagie.text.pdf.ColumnText  exactly at the line 1422:\r\n```\r\nelse if (!table.isSplitRows() && k == listIdx && firstPass) {   \r\n    compositeElements.removeFirst();   \r\n    splittedRow = false;\r\n    continue;\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nsame comments of this code:\r\n**if (!table.isSplitRows() && k == listIdx && firstPass)**\r\nthis condition identify the first row of the table didn't enter in the pdf and this table if the first element analized in the ColumnText context\r\n**compositeElements.removeFirst();** \r\nthe table is removed from the context (also if this is a table of 100 rows!) of th ColumnText, then in case in the context there are no more elements,  later the method result = ct.go(true); will return that there are no more elements and all is wrote correctly in the pdf when this is not true! the table is skiped\r\n\r\nthe correct code should be:\r\n```\r\nelse if (!table.isSplitRows() && k == listIdx && firstPass) {   \r\n             return NO_MORE_COLUMN;\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nwe have another example of correct implementation in the line 1427\r\n```\r\n                    else if (k == listIdx && !firstPass && (!table.isSplitRows() || table.isSplitLate()) && (table.getFooterRows() == 0 || table.isComplete()))\r\n                        return NO_MORE_COLUMN;\r\n```\r\n[BUGColumnTextWihtOnlyTable.txt](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/7693215/BUGColumnTextWihtOnlyTable.txt)\r\n\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/633/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":633,"updated_at":"2022-05-31T21:05:03Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/633/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1076878551,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/633/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":2,"closed_at":"2022-05-31T21:05:03Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/633","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":{"creator":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"asturio","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13033226?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/asturio","site_admin":false,"id":13033226,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzMDMzMjI2","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/orgs"},"closed_at":"2022-07-09T13:25:54Z","description":null,"created_at":"2022-05-14T10:12:21Z","title" loop in xref table causes OOM","body":"I've come across a PDF with the following xref table:\r\n```\r\nxref\r\n7 1\r\n0000061582 00000 n\r\n22 27\r\n0000061874 00000 n\r\n0000063938 00000 n\r\n0000066501 00000 n\r\n0000068901 00000 n\r\n0000071884 00000 n\r\n0000072433 00000 n\r\n0000073108 00000 n\r\n0000073531 00000 n\r\n0000074050 00000 n\r\n0000074586 00000 n\r\n0000075238 00000 n\r\n0000075711 00000 n\r\n0000076290 00000 n\r\n0000076914 00000 n\r\n0000077676 00000 n\r\n0000078196 00000 n\r\n0000078828 00000 n\r\n0000079281 00000 n\r\n0000079840 00000 n\r\n0000080317 00000 n\r\n0000080908 00000 n\r\n0000083108 00000 n\r\n0000085841 00000 n\r\n0000088817 00000 n\r\n0000092520 00000 n\r\n0000092720 00000 n\r\n0000092954 00000 n\r\n\r\ntrailer\r\n<<\/Info 21 0 R/ID[<C55DAE5127C23AC8A732EE9B88B971D8><6D23C287DC7BC30F645F94862D2B65F0>]/Root 20 0 R/Size 49/Prev 93188>>\r\nstartxref\r\n93188\r\n%%EOF\r\n```\r\n\r\nWhen I attempted to create a new PdfReader from this document, my application crashed with an OOM error.\r\nUpon debugging, it looks like there is an infinite loop in the readXref() method:\r\n```java\r\n    while (true) {\r\n      PdfNumber prev = (PdfNumber) trailer2.get(PdfName.PREV);\r\n      if (prev == null)\r\n        break;\r\n      tokens.seek(prev.intValue());\r\n      trailer2 = readXrefSection();\r\n    }\r\n```\r\nas prev.intValue() is the same value as the startxref, which leads to a continuous allocation of memory until it crashes.\r\n\r\npdfinfo (by xdpfreader) confirms this:\r\n```sh\r\n:~ $ pdfinfo brokenpdf.pdf\r\nSyntax Warning: Infinite loop in xref table\r\nSyntax Error: Catalog object is wrong type (null)\r\nSyntax Error: Couldn't read page catalog\r\nSyntax Warning: PDF file is damaged - attempting to reconstruct xref table...\r\nCreationDate:   Tue Nov 30 17:12:33 2021\r\nModDate:        Tue Nov 30 17:12:33 2021\r\nTagged:         no\r\nForm:           none\r\nPages:          1\r\nEncrypted:      no\r\nPage size:      595 x 842 pts (A4) (rotated 0 degrees)\r\nFile size:      93915 bytes\r\nOptimized:      no\r\nPDF version:    1.4\r\n```\r\n\r\nI'm not very familiar with the pdf spec, so I'm not entirely sure if there is any other information needed.  Please let me know if more info is necessary.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":629,"updated_at":"2022-02-03T11:57:48Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1071484545,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":4,"closed_at":"2022-02-03T11:57:48Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/629/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"nfmueller","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/22203641?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nfmueller/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/nfmueller","site_admin":false,"id BaseFont subset prefix generation deterministic","body":"Hello,\r\n\r\nWhile trying to embed a font subset to a PDF, we have faced with an issue in OpenPdf, as it generates a new random name for a font subset each time a single PDF document is generated.\r\n\r\nAs in our signature creation tool, we need to execute the PDF generation twice, one for a ToBeSigned data generation and the second one for a final signed document generation, the generated PDF document shall be produced in a deterministic way.\r\n\r\nThe problem comes from a method [BaseFont.createSubsetPrefix()](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/1.3.26/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/BaseFont.java#L1356) generating a random prefix name for a font when a subset option is used. This makes the use of subsets impossible in our implementation, as the generated PDF and its digest respectively are always different.\r\n\r\nWould it be possible to make the prefix computation deterministic somehow? For example by using _org.bouncycastle.crypto.prng.FixedSecureRandom_ from BouncyCastle and the used glyphs within the provided subset as seed for pseudo random value generation.\r\n\r\nJust for the information, there is no requirement in ISO 32000 to have the prefix random. It just shall be different for different subsets:\r\n\r\n> **9.9.2 Font subsets**\r\n> \r\n> For a font subset, the PostScript name of the font, that is, the value of the font\u2019s BaseFont entry and the \r\n> font descriptor\u2019s FontName entry, shall begin with a tag followed by a plus sign (+) followed by the \r\n> PostScript name of the font from which the subset was created. The tag shall consist of exactly six \r\n> uppercase letters; **the choice of letters is arbitrary**, but **different subsets of the same font in the same** \r\n> **PDF file shall have different tags**.\r\n\r\nThank you!\r\n\r\nBest regards,\r\nAleksandr.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":623,"updated_at":"2021-12-14T20:25:49Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1062212987,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":0,"closed_at":"2021-12-14T20:25:49Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"84b6eb","name":"enhancement","description":null,"id":406365146,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/enhancement","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDY="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":1,"+1":1,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/623/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"bsanchezb","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/23361149?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.co document.\r\nThe following rows will start in the wrong column.\r\nResult:\r\n[testOut.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/7475443/testOut.pdf)\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nCode to reproduce = PdfWriter.getInstance(doc, new FileOutputStream(out));\r\n   doc.open();\r\n   InputStream stream = Main.class.getResourceAsStream(\"test.html\");\r\n   HTMLWorker worker = new HTMLWorker(doc);\r\n   worker.parse(new InputStreamReader(stream));\r\n} catch (IOException e) {\r\n   e.printStackTrace();\r\n} finally {\r\n   doc.close();\r\n   if (writer != null) {\r\n      writer.close();\r\n   }\r\n}\r\n\r\nand this 3rd column, not the 1st.\r\n\r\n**Additional context**\r\nThe solution should actually be pretty simple. Just like the colspan the rowspan needs to be set on the cell when converting from html.\r\nSo just add the following line of code into the constructor of the class an existing PDF document","body":"Can this library be used to shrink (resize to fit) an existing PDF document?\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nThis is the code to resize the pdf pages to A4 with itext 7 library, but I don't know how to do the same with OpenPDF.\r\n\r\n\r\n\t// Open original pdf\r\n\tPdfReader originalPdfReader = new PdfReader(originalPdfFileURI);\r\n\tPdfDocument originalPdf = new PdfDocument(originalPdfReader);\r\n\r\n\t// Generate a copy and open it\r\n\tFile copyPdfFile = new File(\"C:/examples/resized_pdf.pdf\");\r\n\r\n\tPdfWriter copyPdfWriter = new PdfWriter(copyPdfFile);\r\n\tPdfDocument copyPdf = new PdfDocument(copyPdfWriter);\r\n\r\n\t// Copy pages from the original PDF\r\n\tPdfPage originalPage;\r\n\tRectangle originalRect;\r\n\r\n\tPdfPage page;\r\n\tAffineTransform transformationMatrix;\r\n\r\n\tPdfCanvas canvas;\r\n\tPdfFormXObject pageCopy;\r\n\r\n\tfor (int pageIndex = 1; pageIndex <= originalPdf.getNumberOfPages(); pageIndex++) {\r\n\t\t// Open page from original PDF\r\n\t\toriginalPage = originalPdf.getPage(pageIndex);\r\n\r\n\t\t// Get dimensions of the page\r\n\t\toriginalRect = originalPage.getPageSizeWithRotation();\r\n\r\n\t\t// Create new page in pdf copy\r\n\t\tpage = copyPdf.addNewPage(PageSize.A4);\r\n\r\n\t\t// Get transformation matrix\r\n\t\ttransformationMatrix = AffineTransform.getScaleInstance(\r\n\t\t\t\tpage.getPageSize().getWidth() / orig.getWidth(),\r\n\t\t\t\tpage.getPageSize().getHeight() / orig.getHeight());\r\n\r\n\t\t// Apply transformation matrix to page\r\n\t\tcanvas = new PdfCanvas(page);\r\n\t\tcanvas.concatMatrix(transformationMatrix);\r\n\r\n\t\t// Copy the content of original pdf to pdf copy\r\n\t\tpageCopy = origPage.copyAsFormXObject(copyPdf);\r\n\t\tcanvas.addXObjectAt(pageCopy, 0, 0);\r\n\t}\r\n\r\n\t// Save the changes made to pdf copy\r\n\tDocument document = new Document(copyPdf);\r\n\tdocument.close();\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":611,"updated_at":"2021-10-21T08:22:45Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1026137086,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":2,"closed_at":"2021-10-21T08:22:45Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/611/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"borjafg","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6740268?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/borjafg","site_admin":false,"id":6740268,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjY3NDAyNjg=","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/borjafg/orgs"},"node_id":"I_kwDOA8KLhc49KZv-"},{"assignees": mockito-core from 3.12.4 to 4.0.0","body":"Bumps [mockito-core](https://github.com/mockito/mockito) from 3.12.4 to 4.0.0.\n<details>\n<summary>Release notes<\/summary>\n<p><em>Sourced from <a href=\"https://github.com/mockito/mockito/releases\">mockito-core's releases<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n<blockquote>\n<h2>v4.0.0<\/h2>\n<h1>Mockito 4: Removing deprecated APIs.<\/h1>\n<p>All of these APIs have been marked as deprecated and have been present\nin Mockito for quite a while.<\/p>\n<p>An overview of now-deleted classes/methods:<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><code>org.mockito.Matchers<\/code> which was an alias for\n<code>org.mockito.ArgumentMatchers<\/code><\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.ArgumentMatchers#{anyObject,anyVararg}<\/code> both which were\naliases for <code>org.mockito.ArgumentMatchers#any<\/code><\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.ArgumentMatchers#any*Of<\/code>, which were aliases for the same\nmethod name without the Of and the generic parameters (which were\nignored)<\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.ArgumentMatchers#{is}{Not}Null(Class)<\/code> which took a class\nwhich was ignored. Aliases for the same methods without the parameter<\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.MockedStatic#verify<\/code> which had the parameter types reversed<\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.Mockito#verifyZeroInteractions<\/code> an alias of\n<code>verifyNoMoreInteractions<\/code><\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.Mockito#debug<\/code> framework integration API that we later\nrefactored<\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.configuration.AnnotationEngine<\/code> which was leaking internal\nAPIs and instead users should use <code>org.mockito.plugins.AnnotationEngine<\/code><\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.exceptions.verification.TooLittleActualInvocations<\/code> fixed\nthe grammar from &quot;Little&quot; to &quot;Few&quot;<\/li>\n<li>Numerous internal APIs that we never officially supported and can now\nremove<\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.plugins.InstantiatorProvider<\/code> which was leaking internal\nAPIs and instead users should use InstantiatorProvider2 (we should\nprobably rename back to remove the number in a future major release)<\/li>\n<li><code>org.mockito.runners<\/code> a package that hosted several old JUnit runners\nwhich were no longer supported. Users should instead use\n<code>org.mockito.junit.MockitoJUnitRunner<\/code> which is our official JUnit4\nrunner.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<\/blockquote>\n<\/details>\n<details>\n<summary>Commits<\/summary>\n<ul>\n<li><a i.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"dependabot[bot]","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/followers","type":"Bot","url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/in/29110?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/apps/dependabot","site_admin":false,"id":49699333,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDM6Qm90NDk2OTkzMzM=","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/dependabot%5Bbot%5D/orgs"},"node_id":"PR_kwDOA8KLhc4r8fkA"},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2021-09-19T14:34:59Z","title":"Error in parsing of cross reference streams with multiple revisions","body":"**Description**\r\n\r\nWhen reading a cross reference stream, iText/OpenPdf clears the corresponding object from the internal cross reference information as that object ID can be re-used in later revisions and should not be accessed directly by normal user code anyways.\r\n\r\nUnfortunately, if in a multi-revision PDF that object ID indeed has been re-used in a later revision and OpenPdf reads that multi-revision document, the attempt to clear the entry for the cross reference stream actually clears the entry for the object the ID has been re-used for. As a consequence, OpenPdf cannot access that newer object.\r\n\r\nIn iText 5 this issue has been resolved in version 5.3.4.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n\r\nSee [DSS-2570](https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/tracker/browse/DSS-2570).\r\n\r\n**Expected Behavior**\r\n\r\nEither OpenPdf should not clear that entry at all (which would allow user code to easily access cross reference information) or it should clear it only if the object ID has not been re-used. \r\n\r\n**Additional Context**\r\n\r\nCode in OpenPdf:\r\n\r\n```java\r\nthisStream *= 2;\r\nif (thisStream < xref.length)\r\n    xref[thisStream] = -1;\r\n```\r\n_(com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.readXRefStream(int))_\r\n\r\nCode in iText since 5.3.4:\r\n\r\n```java\r\nthisStream *= 2;\r\nif (thisStream + 1 < xref.length && xref[thisStream] == 0 && xref[thisStream + 1] == 0)\r\n    xref[thisStream] = -1;\r\n```\r\n*(com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfReader.readXRefStream(long))*","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":602,"updated_at":"2022-05-31T20:03:36Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1000330269,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":0,"closed_at":"2022-05-31T20:03:36Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/602/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"mkl-public","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/11230215?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mkl-public/event NPE in PdfSmartCopy for some maybe corrupted files","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n\r\nIn some (maybe malformed) pdf files, using PdfSmartCopy throws and NPE at ```PdfSmartCopy.java:103```\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nSorry,  the only buggy file I've that causes the bug contains private data and cannot be shared.\r\nHere is the java test I've implemented to reproduce the bug with that file:\r\n\r\n\r\n```java\r\npublic class TestSmartCopy {\r\n\r\n    \r\n    @Test\r\n    public void testNPE() throws Exception {\r\n        File source = new File(\"src/test/resources/npe_smart_copy.pdf\");\r\n        File dest = new File(\"/tmp/ou1t.pdf\");\r\n        compressPdfSmartCopy(source, dest);\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    \r\n    private void compressPdfSmartCopy(File source, File dest) throws Exception {\r\n        OutputStream os = null;\r\n        InputStream is = null;\r\n        try {\r\n            is = new BufferedInputStream(Files.newInputStream(source.toPath()));\r\n            os = new BufferedOutputStream(Files.newOutputStream(dest.toPath(), StandardOpenOption.CREATE, StandardOpenOption.TRUNCATE_EXISTING));\r\n            compressPdfSmartCopy(is, os);\r\n        } finally {\r\n            os.close();\r\n            is.close();\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n    \r\n    private void compressPdfSmartCopy(InputStream is, OutputStream os) throws Exception {     \r\n        Document doc = new Document();\r\n        \r\n        PdfReader reader = null;\r\n        PdfSmartCopy writer = null;\r\n        try {\r\n            reader = new PdfReader(is);\r\n            writer = new PdfSmartCopy(doc, os);\r\n            \r\n            doc.open();     \r\n            for (int i = 1; i <= reader.getNumberOfPages(); i++) {\r\n                writer.addPage(writer.getImportedPage(reader, i));\r\n            }\r\n        } finally {\r\n            writer.freeReader(reader);\r\n            reader.close();\r\n            writer.close();\r\n            is.close();\r\n        }\r\n        doc.close();\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nI think it's a safe null check.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nAny other details about how to test the new feature or use of compositeFontDrawer configurable","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nMade the use of the 2019s introduced `CompositeFontDrawer` configurable via system property or by setting it programmatically via setter. Staying backwards compatible by enabling the compositeFontDrawer by default.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/587\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nBackwards compatible\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nGenerate PDF with custom mapper that does not default to Helvetica and use different fonts from Sans-Serif. Try using Helvetica without having it installed (e.g. Windows or *nix) and it will simply choose another Sans-Serif font(s) that is able to display the specified character(s).\r\n\r\nWith the new flag enabled the old behaviour is used which works perfectly fine for us since the given fonts in `PdfGraphics2D` were correctly initialized in our code. If in any case on the target system the specified font cannot be found an exception should be thrown rather than using another font (which was done with the old Font in PdfGraphics2D not working / PdfGraphics2D manipulates set Font (not expected)","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\nWe didn't update for a while but the changes from 2019 (commit 15e89ca38126ae1dbe5ec869708370321f0ed265) break all generated PDFs (wrong font used).\r\n\r\nThis can be reproduced with an existing test : `com.lowagie.text.pdf.fonts.FontTest#testBoldSimulationAndStrokeWidth`. \r\n\r\nExecuting the test on my machine (Ubuntu, Java 11) let the `compositeFontDrawer` in `PdfGraphics2D` choose the font \"Deja Vu Bold\" instead of \"Helvetica Bold\". Note: since the `DefaultFontMapper` from OpenPDF is used it will always fallback to Helvetica anyways (`logicalName` is Deja Vu...): https://github.com/mppperez/OpenPDF/blob/f773081d4f169c6d84579a855ebbed1e93cfd8e9/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/DefaultFontMapper.java#L123-L193\r\n\r\nSo this won't have direct affect in the test but if a custom mapper is used that is not restricting to only those 3 fonts you may encounter a problem. _It is not expected that the PdfGraphics2D is changing the specified font on it's own although it was correctly used_. It looks like a project specific issue was built into OpenPDF (see below).\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nExecute above mentioned test on a machine without Helvetica installed.\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nUse the provided font (backwards compatibility is missing) in OpenPDF.\r\n\r\n**Screenshots**\r\n![Screenshot_562](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44845832/129175724-6ca3daee-d024-46f5-a4df-466b1c780d75.png)\r\n\r\n**System (please complete the following information):**\r\n - OS: Ubuntu 20.04\r\n - Used Font: Helvetica\r\n\r\n**Update**\r\nUnfortunately I cannot reconstruct why this fix (see commit above) for Windows was built... or initially Windows and then changed to Mac (see commit history).  It looks like a project specific issue that was implemented in OpenPDF rather than in the appropriate project. At least making the FontDrawer a configurable property seems to be the more proper solution or just using the library with correct fonts instead of logical ones that may not be found.\r\n\r\nFurthermore `PdfGraphics2D.CompositeFontDrawer#splitStringIntoDisplayableParts` will even use different fonts just because they are in the same family as the specified one. If the user of the library wants to write text to a pdf and specifies a font that is not containing (some) characters specified in the text then this should be handled on the users side (may throw an exception? logging and skip? ...) but not in OpenPDF itself? NPE in SimpleBookmark when title element is missing","body":"## Description of the Bugfix\r\nIf the PDF has outlines/bookmarks with no title-element, `SimpleBookmark.getBookmark()` was throwing a *NullPointerException*. This has been fixed by adding a Null-Check. An empty string is used as default in case the title-element is missing.\r\n\r\nFixes #580 \r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the Bugfix\r\n- [x] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nNone.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nA PDF containing a bookmark with no title element has been added in order to test the bugfix. Here is an excerpt of the binary data of this PDF:\r\n\r\n*Empty title element:*\r\n```none\r\n9 0 obj\r\n<<\/A<<\/S/URI/URI(https://www.example.com/2)>>/Next 10 0 R/Title()/Parent 7 0 R/Prev 8 0\r\nR>>\r\nendobj\r\n```\r\n\r\n*No title element since `Title()` is missing:*\r\n```none\r\n10 0 obj\r\n<<\/A<<\/S/URI/URI(https://www.example.com/3)>>/Parent 7 0 R/Prev 9 0 uses wrong file.encoding to write XREF","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\nPDFCrossReference.toPDF(OutputStream os)  should not use getBytes() to write the XREF to the file. If the file.encoding property of java is set to some non ISO or UTF-8 encoding, the file will become corrupt and won't be able to open with Adobe Reader. It can still be opened by browsers though. Instead, getISOBytes() should be used.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n1. Change your file.encoding to something strange like IBM-1047\r\n2. Generate a PDF without isFullCompression. The end of the file will look like this, and Adobe Reader wont be able to open it:\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3976216/126519396-1fd3a890-c384-463f-82fb-2c17555218bf.png)\r\n\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nThe method getISOBytes() should get used instead of getBytes, so that the file.encoding property doesn't matter and the pdf isn't corrupt\r\n\r\n**Screenshots**\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3976216/126519611-fc098db9-529f-4aee-8922-de43786631aa.png)\r\nexpected: You can achieve the same result by closing it manually\n- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the document.close();\r\n    }\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nadd isRTL in TextArray to support RTL.\r\n\r\n## Testing position:\r\n`adjustFirstLine` usually is true\r\nhttps://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/515fb2e648fcd11fbf5ece6cd8c37eabeb763c95/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/ColumnText.java#L1156\r\nin origin version, the `firstPass` is true in this position, but if we add a Paragraph will let it be false.\r\nhttps://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/515fb2e648fcd11fbf5ece6cd8c37eabeb763c95/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/ColumnText.java#L1374\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #536 \r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [x] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n```java\r\n    @Test\r\n    public void TabTest2() throws IOException {\r\n        Document document = new Document(PageSize.A4.rotate(), 10, 10, 10, 10);\r\n        Document.compress = false;\r\n        FileOutputStream stream = new FileOutputStream(\"test.pdf\");\r\n        PdfWriter.getInstance(document, stream);\r\n        document.open();\r\n\r\n        PdfPCell cell;\r\n        PdfPTable mainTable = new PdfPTable(1);\r\n        mainTable.setWidthPercentage(100);\r\n\r\n        cell = new PdfPCell(new Phrase(\"HEADER 1\"));\r\n        cell.setBorder(Rectangle.BOX);\r\n        mainTable.addCell(cell);\r\n\r\n        cell = new PdfPCell(new Phrase(\"HEADER 2\"));\r\n        cell.setBorder(Rectangle.BOX);\r\n        mainTable.addCell(cell);\r\n\r\n        cell = new PdfPCell(new Phrase(\"HEADER 3\"));\r\n        cell.setBorder(Rectangle.BOX);\r\n        mainTable.addCell(cell);\r\n\r\n        for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) {\r\n            cell = new PdfPCell(new Phrase(\"ROW \"+i));\r\n            cell.setBorder(Rectangle.BOX);\r\n            mainTable.addCell(cell);\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        mainTable.setHeaderRows(3);\r\n        mainTable.setSkipFirstHeader(true);\r\n        mainTable.setSplitLate(false);\r\n        document.add(mainTable);\r\n        document.close();\r\n    }\r\n```\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nNo\r\n\r\n## Testing pages.\r\n```\r\ndocument.open();\r\nPdfPCell cell;\r\nPdfPTable mainTable = new PdfPTable(1);\r\nmainTable.setWidthPercentage(100);\r\n\r\ncell = new PdfPCell(new Phrase(\"HEADER The hebrew letters were written backwards, like english. I thought I had broke something until I tried changing the alignment to \"Right\" and \"Center\".\r\nI had written this in Kotlin, but since Kotlin is compatable with Java, I don't think there will be any difference between the two.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nCode to reproduce the issue\r\n1. "asturio","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13033226?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/asturio","site_admin":false,"id":13033226,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzMDMzMjI2","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/orgs"}],"created_at":"2021-04-25T12:28:13Z","title":"Fix #408: Add a lock for protecting fontFamilies from race condition","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n\r\n**DO NOT MERGE until there exists a unit test that can validate this patch.**\r\n\r\nThis bug originates from iText 2, and it is caused by the race condition since it is possible to read from the list stored in the hashmap `fontFamilies` by the function `getFont()` and write to the same list by the function `registerFamily()` concurrently. Thus, the idea of this patch is to disallow accessing that hashmap simultaneously. This implementation utilizes `ReentrantReadWriteLock`, which will gain performance improvement under certain scenarios compared to other synchronization approaches.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #408, opensagres/xdocreport#59\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n\r\nSo far, I didn't figure out a way to reproduce that bug because this issue is caused by concurrency. Therefore, as @giangnvt said, the possibility of triggering this bug is quite low. from\r\n\r\n```java\r\nfloat bottom = cell.getTop() + cell.getEffectivePaddingBottom() - newHeight;\r\nfloat top = cell.getTop() - cell.getEffectivePaddingTop();\r\n```\r\n\r\nto\r\n\r\n```java\r\nfloat top = cell.getTop() - cell.getEffectivePaddingTop();\r\nfloat bottom = top + cell.getEffectivePaddingBottom() - newHeight;\r\n```\r\n\r\nHowever, the change is actually wrong, which introduced a bug found in issue #345.\r\n\r\nI draw a figure to show the calculation process. log:\r\n```\r\n[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-gpg-plugin:1.6:sign (sign-artifacts) on project openpdf-parent: Unable to execute gpg command: Error while executing process. Cannot run program \"gpg.exe\": CreateProcess error=2, The system cannot find the file specified -> [Help 1]\r\n[ERROR]\r\n[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.\r\n[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.\r\n[ERROR]\r\n[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:\r\n[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/MojoExecutionException\r\n```\r\nAs suggested here:\r\nhttps://stackoverflow.com/questions/59281804/maven-unable-to-execute-gpg-command\r\n\r\nI just replaced the plugin to \r\nhttps://www.simplify4u.org/sign-maven-plugin/key-prepare.html\r\nand everything worked out just well.\r\n\r\nNow I can build the library without any errors.\r\n\r\nThough I do not know the consequences.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: no document:\r\n\r\n```\r\n\tpublic byte[] exportJasperPrintToPDFADocument(JasperPrint print) throws JRException {\r\n\t\tbyte[] bytes = null;\r\n\r\n\t\tByteArrayOutputStream stream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();\r\n\t\tJRPdfExporter exporter = new JRPdfExporter();\r\n\t\texporter.setExporterInput(new SimpleExporterInput(print));\r\n\t\texporter.setExporterOutput(new SimpleOutputStreamExporterOutput(\r\n\t\t\t\tstream));\r\n\r\n\t\tSimplePdfExporterConfiguration spec = new when exporting JasperPrint to PDF/A document","body":"Hello,\r\n\r\nI'm using JasperReports with OpenPDF and I can not export JasperPrint to PDF/A document.\r\n\r\nI'm using jasperreports exportReport() method from JRPdfExporter which calls method  com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter.getInstance(Document document, OutputStream os) in which object com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfDocument is constructed with constructor :\r\n\r\n```\r\n    public PdfDocument() {\r\n        super();\r\n    }\r\n```\r\nProblem is that NPE occurs when XMPMeta object is created and populated with properties that consists of XML namespaces, names and values. Two of these properties names are CreateDate and ModifiedDate and their values are read from PdfDictionary com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter.getInfo() object. These values don't exist in PdfDictionary.\r\n\r\nConstructor of net.sf.jasperreports.engine.export.XmpWriter class:\r\n\r\n```\r\n    XmpWriter(PdfWriter pdfWriter)\r\n    {\r\n        this.pdfWriter = pdfWriter;\r\n        this.info = pdfWriter.getInfo();\r\n    }\r\n```\r\n\r\nNPE occurs at these lines of code:\r\n```\r\nxmp.setProperty(XMPConst.NS_XMP, XMP_CREATE_DATE, ((PdfDate) info.get(PdfName.CREATIONDATE)).getW3CDate());\r\nxmp.setProperty(XMPConst.NS_XMP, XMP_MODIFY_DATE, ((PdfDate) info.get(PdfName.MODDATE)).getW3CDate());\r\n```\r\n\r\nCan you change constructor to (like in iText versions 2.7.1 and 4.2.1) : \r\n```\r\n    public PdfDocument() {\r\n        super();\r\n        addProducer();\r\n        addCreationDate();\r\n    }\r\n```\r\n\r\nI can create Pull-request if using PdfCopyFields (broken since v1.1.0)","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\n\r\nHere is a sample document with a table of contents on the first page: [openpdf_bug_test.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/6100746/openpdf_bug_test.pdf)\r\n\r\nI want to copy only the first page into a new file using code like this...\r\n\r\n```\r\n            InputStream stream = Main.class.getResourceAsStream(\"openpdf_bug_test.pdf\");\r\n\r\n            PdfReader reader = new PdfReader(stream);\r\n\r\n            byte[] bytes;\r\n\r\n            try (ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream()) {\r\n\r\n                PdfCopyFields pdfCopyFields = new PdfCopyFields(baos);\r\n\r\n                pdfCopyFields.addDocument(reader, \"1\"); // <-- just the table of contents\r\n\r\n                pdfCopyFields.close(); // <-- bang\r\n\r\n                baos.flush();\r\n\r\n                bytes = baos.toByteArray();\r\n            }\r\n\r\n            try (OutputStream os = new FileOutputStream(new File(\"output.pdf\"))) {\r\n                os.write(bytes);\r\n            }\r\n```\r\n\r\n... and get this exception:\r\n\r\n```\r\njava.lang.NullPointerException\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter$PdfBody.add(PdfWriter.java:394)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter$PdfBody.add(PdfWriter.java:390)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter.addToBody(PdfWriter.java:829)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfCopyFieldsImp.closeIt(PdfCopyFieldsImp.java:408)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfCopyFieldsImp.close(PdfCopyFieldsImp.java:368)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfCopyFields.close(PdfCopyFields.java:162)\r\n\tat Main.main(Main.java:30)\r\n```\r\n\r\nSince OpenPDF v1.1.0 it only works if I specify \"1-2\" as a range because otherwise a NullPointerException occurs due to the missing page refs in the table of contents.\r\n\r\nUp to v1.0.5 it was possible to just copy range \"1\" and the missing page refs will be ignored.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n\r\nFull reproducer project:\r\n[OpenPdfBugReproducer.zip](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/6100688/OpenPdfBugReproducer.zip)\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\n\r\nIf a page has a reference to another page that's not part of the exported range this reference should just be ignored or stripped out. This seems to be what happens in version 1.0.5 and the old iText library.\r\n\r\nMaybe you won't want to allow this per default, but then there should be a way better exception than a NullPointerException. But I would still need an option to force that copy even if page references get lost.\r\n\r\n**System (please complete the following information):**\r\n - OS: Windows\r\n - Used Font: Not class;<\/li>\n<li>remove unused <code>URLUtilities<\/code> class;<\/li>\n<li>removed <code>@since 1.0.x<\/code> Javadoc tags since these do not provide useful information
