if the annotation belongs to a valid page","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nHello!\r\n\r\nCould someone more experienced with the library please check if this fix makes sense? We are replacing iText:2.1.5 with OpenPDF in an application, and I found a [very old] unit test (with a PDF document which, at least for now, I can't share) that fails with the following stacktrace:\r\n\r\n```\r\njava.lang.NullPointerException\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfStamperImp.flatFields(PdfStamperImp.java:880)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfStamperImp.close(PdfStamperImp.java:162)\r\n\tat com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfStamper.close(PdfStamper.java:246)\r\n\tat [ommited-package-name].PdfTest.getStampedPdf(PdfTest.java:60)\r\n\tat [ommited-package-name].PdfTest.shouldLoadAndFlatAPdfStamped(PdfTest.java:51)\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe unit test had a comment on it saying that [_once upon a time..._] iText was bumped from 2.1.5 to 2.1.7 but this issue arised, so they reverted it [and kept until today...] to 2.1.5. I was able to find out that [this block of code](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/master/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/AcroFields.java#L239) didn't exist in 2.1.5 but was there in 2.1.7. After debugging said unit test, I came up with this fix.\r\n\r\nThe commit message has more details. Basically, it doesn't assume a PdfAppearance for a \"pageless annotation\" anymore.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #\r\nNone.\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nNo unit tests were added or modified.\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nNo compatibility issues. Existing unit tests execute correctly.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nWe have a PDF document which would trigger the issue, but unfortunatelly we cannot share I tested the same PDF with aspose-pdf and pdfbox and it gets opened just fine, so looks like this is OpenPDF related. href=\"https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/jfree/jfreechart/pull/79\">#79<\/a>);<\/li>\n<li>deprecated <code>PiePlot3D<\/code> and related methods, for 3D pie charts, use Orson Charts (<a from <a href=\"https://github.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md\">spotbugs's changelog<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n<blockquote>\n<h2>4.2.0 - 2020-11-28<\/h2>\n<h3>Fixed<\/h3>\n<ul>\n<li>spotbugs reports <code>VO_VOLATILE_REFERENCE_TO_ARRAY<\/code> in synthetic code generated by Eclipse 4.17+ Java compiler (<a href=\"https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/issues/1313\">#1313<\/a>)<\/li>\n<li>spotbugs reports <code>DM_BOXED_PRIMITIVE_FOR_PARSING<\/code> for Double and Float (previously only reported for Integer and Long) (<a href=\"https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/issues/744\">#744<\/a>)<\/li>\n<li>sarif report not showing correctly the physical and logical location (<a href=\"https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/issues/1281\">#1281<\/a>)<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h3>Added<\/h3>\n<ul>\n<li>The class search (in the GUI's class name filter) is now case-insensitive and forgives typos (part of (<a href=\"https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/spotbugs/spotbugs/issues/749\">#749<\/a>))<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h3>Changed<\/h3>\n<ul>\n<li>Bump Saxon-HE from 10.2 to 10.3<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<\/blockquote>\n<\/details>\n<details>\n<summary>Commits<\/summary>\n<ul>\n<li><a You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.\n\n[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)\n[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)\n\n---\n\n<details>\n<summary>Dependabot commands and options<\/summary>\n<br />\n\nYou can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:\n- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR\n- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it\n- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it\n- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it\n- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging\n- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed\n- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually\n- `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the done for tab character as per the TTF file.\r\nBelow is link to typography specs:\r\nhttps://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/gsub\r\n\r\n**Below is code to Reproduce**\r\npackage test;\r\n\r\nimport java.io.BufferedOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;\r\nimport java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.File;\r\nimport java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.IOException;\r\nimport java.io.InputStream;\r\nimport java.net.URL;\r\n\r\nimport org.apache.poi.util.IOUtils;\r\nimport org.apache.poi.xwpf.converter.pdf.PdfConverter;\r\nimport org.apache.poi.xwpf.converter.pdf.PdfOptions;\r\nimport org.apache.poi.xwpf.usermodel.XWPFDocument;\r\n\r\nimport fr.opensagres.xdocreport.core.XDocReportException;\r\nimport fr.opensagres.xdocreport.document.IXDocReport;\r\nimport fr.opensagres.xdocreport.document.registry.XDocReportRegistry;\r\nimport fr.opensagres.xdocreport.template.IContext;\r\nimport fr.opensagres.xdocreport.template.TemplateEngineKind;\r\nimport fr.opensagres.xdocreport.template.formatter.FieldsMetadata;\r\n/**\t\r\n * \r\n * @author pallavi.saini \r\n *\r\n */\r\npublic class OpenPdf {\r\n\r\n\tpublic static void main(String[] args) throws XDocReportException, IOException {\r\n\t\tPdfOptions options = PdfOptions.create();\r\n\t\tString templatePath = \"D:\\\\Workspace\\\\ThankYouNote_Template.docx\";\r\n\t\tURL url = new File(templatePath).toURI().toURL();\r\n\t\tInputStream inputStream = url.openStream();\r\n\t\tIXDocReport xdocReport = XDocReportRegistry.getRegistry().loadReport(inputStream, null,\r\n                TemplateEngineKind.Freemarker, false);\r\n\t\tFieldsMetadata metadata = xdocReport.createFieldsMetadata();\r\n\t    metadata.setTemplateEngineKind(\"Freemarker\");\r\n\t    xdocReport.setFieldsMetadata(metadata);\r\n\t\tIContext context = xdocReport.createContext();\r\n\t\tcontext.put(\"name\", \"RAJ\\tVIHAR\");\r\n\t\tByteArrayOutputStream outputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();\r\n\t\txdocReport.process(context, outputStream);\r\n\r\n\t\tXWPFDocument document = new XWPFDocument(new ByteArrayInputStream(outputStream.toByteArray()));\r\n\t\tByteArrayOutputStream out = new ByteArrayOutputStream();\r\n\t\tPdfConverter.getInstance().convert(document, out, options);\r\n\t\twriteToPdfFile(out.toByteArray(), \"D:\\\\Workspace\\\\ThankYouNote_Template.pdf\");\r\n\r\n\t}\r\n\r\n\tprivate static void writeToPdfFile(byte[] fileContent, String path) {\r\n\r\n\t\tBufferedOutputStream bs = null;\r\n\t\tFileOutputStream fs = null;\r\n\t\ttry {\r\n\r\n\t\t\tfs = new FileOutputStream(new File(path));\r\n\t\t\tbs = new BufferedOutputStream(fs);\r\n\t\t\tbs.write(fileContent);\r\n\t\t\tbs.close();\r\n\t\t\tbs = null;\r\n\t\t} catch (Exception e) {\r\n\t\t\te.printStackTrace();\r\n\t\t} finally {\r\n\t\t\tIOUtils.closeQuietly(fs);\r\n\t\t}\r\n\r\n\t}\r\n\r\n}\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nThe text should be visible as \"Raj   Vihar\" instead of \"RajVihar\". Unit-Test\r\n\r\n```java\r\n    @Test\r\n    public void test() {\r\n       // setup AES 128 encryption\r\n       PdfEncryption decrypt = new PdfEncryption();\r\n       decrypt.setCryptoMode(PdfWriter.ENCRYPTION_AES_128, 0);\r\n       byte[] key = new byte[16]; // create fake key, it does not matter for this test\r\n       decrypt.setupByEncryptionKey(key, 128);\r\n       decrypt.setHashKey(0, 0);\r\n       // try to decrypt an empty array\r\n       byte[] result = decrypt.decryptByteArray(new byte[] {});\r\n       // empty array expected in result and no exception\r\n       Assert.assertNotNull(result);\r\n       Assert.assertEquals(result.length, 0);\r\n    }\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nno Letters composed of Unicode base letter and combining accent are rendered incorrectly. ","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\n\r\nThe position of the accents is incorrect for most of the character sequences \r\ndefined in the following specification:\r\n\r\nDIN SPEC 91379: Characters in Unicode for the electronic processing of names \r\nand data exchange in Europe; with digital attachment\r\nhttps://www.xoev.de/downloads-2316#StringLatin\r\nhttps://www.din.de/de/wdc-beuth:din21:301228458\r\n\r\n\r\nE.g. with 0041 030B LATIN CAPITAL LETTER A WITH COMBINING DOUBLE ACUTE ACCENT \r\nthe accent appears at the right hand side of the letter A, not above the \r\nletter A.\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nThe output of LibrePdf/OpenPdf 1.3.22 is appended in [din-spec-91379-openpdf.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/5453965/din-spec-91379-openpdf.pdf), \r\nwhich is created by running [OpenPdfTest.java](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/5453964/OpenPdfTest.java.txt) using [pdf-form.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/5453962/pdf-form.pdf).\r\n\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nThe correct rendering should look like the output of Harfbuzz hb-view 2.6.8 \r\nfor [din-spec-91379-hb-view-2.6.8.txt](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/5453967/din-spec-91379-hb-view-2.6.8.txt), see [din-spec-91379-hb-view-2.6.8.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/5453968/din-spec-91379-hb-view-2.6.8.pdf). \r\nHarfbuzz uses the info in the OpenType GPOS table for is bolder than expected","body":"Hi!\r\nI'm using OpenPDF 1.3.20. \r\nI found that Drawing text with a bold + underline font results in a stroke that is bolder than just using bold. \r\nIs this expected? Is any workaround to make the font less thick?\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/538127/92786367-90dc3180-f37e-11ea-938b-42dff0c1a501.png)\r\n\r\nSample test code:\r\n```java\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Chunk;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Document;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Font;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.FontFactory;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Paragraph;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Phrase;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;\r\n\r\nimport java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.IOException;\r\n\r\npublic class scratch_6 {\r\n    public static final String CREATED_PDF = \"TestFonts.pdf\";\r\n\r\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\r\n        Document document = new Document();\r\n        try {\r\n            PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(CREATED_PDF));\r\n            document.open();\r\n\r\n            Phrase chunk1 = new Phrase(\"BOLD\", FontFactory.getFont(FontFactory.COURIER, 12, Font.BOLD));\r\n            Phrase chunk2 = new Phrase(\"BOLD+UNDERLINE\", FontFactory.getFont(FontFactory.COURIER, 12, Font.BOLD | Font.UNDERLINE));\r\n            Phrase chunk3 = new Phrase(\"NORMAL\", FontFactory.getFont(FontFactory.COURIER, 12, Font.NORMAL));\r\n\r\n            Paragraph para = new Paragraph();\r\n            para.add(chunk1);\r\n            para.add(chunk2);\r\n            para.add(chunk3);\r\n            para.setKeepTogether(true);\r\n            document.add(para);\r\n        }\r\n        catch (DocumentException | IOException de) {\r\n            System.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n        }\r\n        document.close();\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n\r\n```\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":405,"updated_at":"2021-02-04T18:27:10Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":698371280,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":6,"closed_at":"2021-02-04T18:27:10Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/405/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"asturio","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/13033226?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/asturio/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/asturio","site_admin":false,"id":13033226,"gravatar_id" code:\r\n```Java\r\nfor (String test : new String[] { \"0000FEFF\", \"EFBBBF77\", \"FEFF7777\", \"FFFE0000\", \"FFFE7777\", \"77777777\" }) {\r\n    byte[] buf = Hex.decode(test);\r\n    String our = detectCharsetFromBOM(buf);\r\n    String prev = org.mozilla.universalchardet.UniversalDetector.detectCharsetFromBOM(buf);\r\n    System.out.printf(\"%-8s %-8s %-8s %b%n\", test, our, prev, Objects.equals(our, prev));\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nwhich produces\r\n\r\n```\r\n0000FEFF UTF-32BE UTF-32BE true\r\nEFBBBF77 UTF-8    UTF-8    true\r\nFEFF7777 UTF-16BE UTF-16BE true\r\nFFFE0000 UTF-32LE UTF-32LE true\r\nFFFE7777 UTF-16LE UTF-16LE true\r\n77777777 null     null     true\r\n```\r\n(creating an actual test would be difficult, and also would need to keep old dependency to juniversalchardet or make it an optional dependency","body":"Dear all,\r\n\r\nis it possible to remove the dependency to this extra library? I see that it is used only in one place, to get the encoding of an xml-document from the bom header, see com.lowagie.text.xml.simpleparser.SimpleXMLParser.parse(...)\r\nThe logic in UniversalDetector.detectCharsetFromBOM(...) is not so special and complex and is not prone to be changed in the future. I know that reusing sourcecode is good practice. But in this situation copying the code is acceptable in my opinion because of the advantages of fewer dependencies and lesser efforts in maintaining an extra library and so on.\r\n\r\nSee also this brought a new issue for our application. Paragraphs with more than one chunk and different fonts lead to unexpected line breaks inside a paragraph. \r\n\r\nCode to reproduce:\r\n\r\n```java\r\npublic class TestBad134 {\r\n\tpublic static final String CREATED_PDF = \"./src/test/TestBad134.pdf\";\r\n\r\n\tpublic static void main(String[] args) {\r\n\t\tDocument document = new Document();\r\n\t\ttry {\r\n\t\t\tPdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(CREATED_PDF));\r\n\t\t\tdocument.open();\r\n\r\n\t\t\tChunk chunk1 = new Chunk(\"Hier \", FontFactory.getFont(BaseFont.COURIER, 10));\r\n\t\t\tChunk chunk2 = new Chunk(\"fetter\", FontFactory.getFont(BaseFont.COURIER_BOLD, 10));\r\n\t\t\tChunk chunk3 = new Chunk(\" Text\", FontFactory.getFont(BaseFont.COURIER, 10));\r\n\r\n\t\t\tParagraph para = new Paragraph();\r\n\t\t\tpara.add(chunk1);\r\n\t\t\tpara.add(chunk2);\r\n\t\t\tpara.add(chunk3);\r\n\t\t\tpara.setKeepTogether(true);\r\n\t\t\tdocument.add(para);\r\n\t\t}\r\n\t\tcatch (DocumentException | IOException de) {\r\n\t\t\tSystem.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n\t\t}\r\n\t\tdocument.close();\r\n\t}\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nResult is: signatures broken since 1.2.18","body":"This apparently harmless change in eb875bc24b688ced9b7ea57e021b1c48cec32ea9 broke (some) digital signatures due to rounding:\r\n```diff\r\n      bf.append('[');\r\n-     for (int i : range) bf.append(i).append(' ');\r\n+     for (long i : range) bf.append(i).append(' ');\r\n      bf.append(']');\r\n```\r\n\u2026because `ByteBuffer.append(int)` exists, while `ByteBuffer.append(long)` does not and thus implicitly uses `ByteBuffer.append(float)`, where the value doesn't fit exactly.\r\n\r\nFinal effect is a signature where this happens:\r\n```diff\r\n-/Filter/Adobe.PPKLite/Type/Sig/ByteRange [0 178 3704 225636843 ]\r\n+/Filter/Adobe.PPKLite/Type/Sig/ByteRange [0 178 3704 225636848 ]\r\n```\r\nNotice that the fourth number gets rounded up to the next multiple of 16, this breaks the range calculation by actually going after the end of file, but in other instances it is rounded down and we get a signature \"not covering the full document\" and also broken in any case, as during the signature the range used was right, so the hash is different.\r\n\r\nSmallest diff solution is using an explicit cast to double to avoid implicit cast to float:\r\n```diff\r\n      bf.append('[');\r\n-     for (long i : range) bf.append(i).append(' ');\r\n+     for (long i : range) bf.append((double) i).append(' ');\r\n      bf.append(']');\r\n```\r\n\u2026but I think that using `double`s to print `int`s and `long`s is really ugly, and probably re-writing both those methods to print an integral number directly is cleaner.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/383/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":383,"updated_at":"2020-06-24T11:20:32Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/383/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":643896812,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/383/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":6,"closed_at":"2020-06-23T16:03:00Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/383","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="},{"default":true,"color":"128A0C","name":"help WebColors transparency","body":"In 7e5a8f0597886caa741d60f412fd5dbd2a62cd54 was added transparency to objects.\r\n\r\nThere was a bug in WebColors where transparency value for colors was reversed (using 0 as opaque and 255 as transparent, but its 0 for transparent and 255 for opaque [java.awt.Color API](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/awt/Color.html))\r\n\r\nThis cause all text using WebColors (HTMLWorker for example) to be transparent and not visible in the generated pdf.\r\n\r\nI provide two samples. Those examples work in OpenPDF 1.3.11 and fails (show invisible text) in 1.3.12+. they work fine with this Pull Request.\r\n\r\n\r\nExample with a Chuck using a color from WebColors.\r\n```\r\n  private static void exampleWithChuchk() {\r\n    try (Document document = new Document()) {\r\n      PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(\"/tmp/chunkExample.pdf\"));\r\n      document.open();\r\n      Font font = new Font(Font.HELVETICA, Font.DEFAULTSIZE, Font.NORMAL);\r\n      Color color = WebColors.getRGBColor(\"red\");\r\n      font.setColor(color);\r\n      Chunk chunk = new Chunk(\"Hello World!\", font);\r\n      document.add(chunk);\r\n    } catch (DocumentException | IOException de) {\r\n      System.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n```\r\n\r\nExample  with HTMLWorker\r\n\r\n```java\r\n  private static void exampleWithHtml() {\r\n    try (Document document = new Document()) {\r\n      PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(\"/tmp/htmlExample.pdf\"));\r\n      document.open();\r\n      String html = \r\n          \"<table color='black' bgcolor='gray'>\" + \r\n              \"<tr>\" + \r\n              \"<td>Name<\/td>\" +\r\n              \"<td>Surname<\/td>\" + \r\n              \"<td>09.06.2020<\/td>\"\r\n          + \"<\/tr> \" + \r\n           \"<\/table>\";\r\n      StringReader reader = new StringReader(html);\r\n      StyleSheet style = new StyleSheet();\r\n      for (Element o : HTMLWorker.parseToList(reader, style)) {\r\n        document.add(o);\r\n      }\r\n\r\n    } catch (DocumentException | IOException de) {\r\n      System.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n```","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/378/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":378,"updated_at":"2020-06-11T17:38:38Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/378/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":636453449,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/378/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/378.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/378","merged_at":"2020-06-10T21:10:29Z","diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/378.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/378"},"state_reason":null,"comments":6,"closed_at":"2020-06-10T21:10:29Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/378","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/378/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/378","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":2,"+1":1,"rocket":1,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/378/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"albfernandez","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/albfernandez/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent NPE occurs.\r\n\r\nIt occurs as I see now, when a page break occurs and the table uses a background color (lightgrey).\r\nI use .setTableFitsPage(true), but when using .setTableFitsPage(false), there is the NPE as well.\r\n\r\nAs long as the the table with background color does not exceed the remaining space (or no background color ist used), it is drawn, too.\r\nSo the NPE occurs when exceeding the remaining page size and when background color is used.\r\n\r\nNOTE: with openPdf 1.3.11 my code worked and no NPE occured. issues introduced with Apache FOP:","body":"When updating to the latest OpenPDF version we observed that adopting Apache FOP led to some unexpected changes of behavior. I've tried to restore previous behavior with the code changes of this pull request, or at least to mitigate the effects. This pull requests addresses the following two issues:\r\n\r\n1. With Apache FOP, if a glyph was not found in a font, there would be inserted the character '#'. This is different to previous behavior where nothing was changed, and it is especially annoying when one has got a string containing '\\n' or similar characters. Therefore, I've restored the previous behavior.\r\n\r\n2. Apache FOP supports ligatures. Because ligatures are not used in the same way in every language, Apache FOP asks for the language before substituting anything. The current default of OpenPDF is the language \"dflt\", which just means: Use ligatures wherever possible. I've not restored the previous default in this case (because using ligatures is fine), but made the language configurable per document, as some kind of work-around. I know that more would desireable here (e.g. specifying the language of each phrase), but I can't spend more time to this point at the moment (especially because I'm currently investigating more cases of changed behavior).\r\n\r\nI hope you are ok with these to add fillColor operation with PdfSpotColor, but references to GraphicState and ColorState don't exists in final PDF","body":"I'm trying to merge multiple PDFs that represent layers into a single new PDF. This works, but another thing I need to do is replace a regular `fillColor` operation with a `fillColor` & `SpotColor` combination. \r\n\r\nCurrently I read the `byte[]` of each layers' PDF by using `getPageContent()` into a variable. I use the `PRTokenizer` to iterate through the tokens and when I come across the `\"rg\"` operation I inject the operations for color filling with a spotcolor.\r\n\r\nI have a `List<Byte>` in which I will store all existing bytes from `getPageContent()` while iterating it.\r\n\r\nThe Injection is currently done as follows:\r\n- construct a new `PdfContentByte` instance (using a PdfWriter that has the layers' PDF imported on its contentByte) \r\n- create the SpotColor with a specific name and RGB values copied from the `\"rg\"` operation\r\n- call the `setColorFill()` on the new PdfContentByte instance.\r\n- convert the PdfContentByte to `byte[]` by using `toPdf()` (again using the PdfWriter mentioned).\r\n- iterate the `byte[]` and add every entry to the `List<Byte>`.\r\n\r\nWhen the injection is done the main iteration of the layer will continue and all other existing bytes will be added. \r\n\r\nWhen a layer is completely iterated I convert the `List<Byte>` back to `byte[]` and use that for calling `setPageContent()` to update the layer with the SpotColor operation injected.\r\n\r\nFinally I add the layer to the final PDF and when all layers are done I `close()` the document.\r\n\r\nThis all gives no compiler and/or runtime issues and exports a PDF with the layers. The PDF is even visible in MacOS preview.\r\n\r\nSadly, when opening the PDF in Acrobat it gives an error and no layers are displayed.\r\nI validated the PDF and it gives the following errors:\r\n- Missing ColorSpace (3 matches, 1 page)\r\n- Missing Extended Graphic State (3 matches, 1 page)\r\n\r\nThe 3 matches are because there are 3 layers in which I try to add the SpotColor.\r\nI'm not sure what to do about the missing references and/or why they aren't added/copied to the final PDF. illegal reflective access operation","body":"Since java 9 and module system the \"--illegal-access\" parameter was added. The default value for this parameter is \"permit\", but in a future release it will be \"deny\". Read more about it [here](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/tools/java.htm) or [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50251798/what-is-an-illegal-reflective-access).\r\n\r\nThis fix for the [issue 331](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/331) added opens package \"sun.font\" in module \"java.desktop\" if this package is opend for the caller module (actually unnamed module). I assumed that when java opens some module for an unnamed module, this information is automatically added to this module, but it does not happen. This code adds this information manually, which avoids the \"An illegal reflective access operation\" warning.\r\nIn the future it is important not to forget to add the parameter \"--add-opens\" if iText will be a named module or \"-illegal-access=deny\" by default will be used (for named module - for unnamed modules it doesn't work).\r\nTested for Oracle JDK 8 & [Oracle JDK 13.0.2](https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk13-downloads-5672538.html).\r\n\r\nP.S. Please check if there are some other ways to fix [issue 331](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/331).","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/332/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":332,"updated_at":"2020-01-31T14:45:25Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/332/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":557473619,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/332/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/332.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/332","merged_at":"2020-01-30T15:50:19Z","diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/332.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/332"},"state_reason":null,"comments":1,"closed_at":"2020-01-30T15:50:19Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/332","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/332/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/332","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":2,"+1":1,"rocket":0,"hooray":1,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/332/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"V-F","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/V-F/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/10184824?v=4","events_url":"h text from PDF with embedded Identity-H font fails","body":"### Summary\r\n\r\nExtracting the text from an file with an embedded Identity-H font previously created by OpenPDF fails (sample file: [identity-h.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/4118041/identity-h.pdf)). It just returns an empty string instead of \"Hello World\".\r\n\r\nI'm using the latest release.\r\n\r\n### Discoveries during debugging\r\n\r\nI was able to trace the issue to https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/bf9f968089b5d5818ad11be282f8de466dd3da18/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/parser/ParsedText.java#L283\r\n\r\nGetting the original chars on the PDF text in case of Identity-H returns an empty char-array. The implementation returns an empty array if the encoding is not null. Setting the encoding to null doesn't help, because the logic in getOriginalChars doesn't return the proper byte-values.\r\n\r\nhttps://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/master/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/parser/ParsedText.java#L120:L124\r\n\r\nThe CID-Map decoding on the font directly seems to work fine. Calling decode on the CMapAwareDocumentFont using the value of the pdf string (graphicsState.getFont().decode(pdfText.value)) returns the proper expected text.\r\n\r\nMy attempts to fix this failed, I don't understand the logic behind the getOriginalChars of List no longer render \"bulletpoint\"-characters properly","body":"After upgrading to version 1.3.11 I noticed that my lists using `ZapfDingbatsList` do not render as they did previously. The \"bulletpoint\"-characters no longer seem to function properly. Actually all subclasses of `List` are affected by this bug.\r\n\r\n_The following sample code is used to demonstrate the issue:_\r\n```\r\nList list = new ZapfDingbatsList(43, 21);\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item A\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item B\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item C\"));\r\ndocument.add(list);\r\n\r\nlist = new ZapfDingbatsNumberList(43, 21);\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item A\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item B\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item C\"));\r\ndocument.add(list);\r\n\r\nlist = new RomanList(true, 21);\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item A\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item B\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item C\"));\r\ndocument.add(list);\r\n\r\nlist = new GreekList(true, 21);\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item A\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item B\"));\r\nlist.add(new ListItem(\"Item C\"));\r\ndocument.add(list);\r\n```\r\n\r\n_Here are the different results:_\r\n<img width=\"236\" alt=\"render-2-versions\" src=\"https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53262016/71845134-ef526100-30c7-11ea-9510-e84a9cda18bd.png\">\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nThe issue was introduced when the signature of `List#add` was changed to accept an `Element` instead of an `Object` without refactoring the subclasses as well. The `add`-method in `RomanList`, `GreekList`, `ZapfDingbatsList` and `ZapfDingbatsNumberList` are therefore not called (implicitly) since the `add`-method in `List` (baseclass) has a more specific signature.\r\n\r\n---\r\n\r\nAs a workaround until the bug is fixed and a new version is released, the following code which explicitly calls the correct method by casting and using the actual subclass can be used:\r\n```\r\nZapfDingbatsList remarks = new ZapfDingbatsList(43, 21);\r\nremarks.add((Object) new ListItem(\"Item A\"));\r\nremarks.add((Object) new ListItem(\"Item B\"));\r\nremarks.add((Object) new ListItem(\"Item C\"));\r\n```","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":322,"updated_at":"2020-01-19T12:08:46Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":545914168,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":2,"closed_at":"2020-01-16T07:37:54Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":3,"+1":1,"rocket":1,"hooray":1,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/322/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"mluppi","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/53262016?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/mluppi","site_admin":false,"id":53262016,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjUzMjYyMDE2","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/mluppi/orgs"},"node_id":"MDU6SXNzdWU1NDU5MTQxNjg="},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2020-01-06T11:21:40Z","title":"Issue-320: uses hardcoded digest algorithm SHA-1 for timestamp imprint. Doesn't support any other algorithm (e.g. SHA-256)","body":"OpenPDF being forked from Itext4 is till using hard coded SHA-1 digest for timestamp imprint. Itext, itext5 onwards, allows to use TSAClient to get timestamp imprints\r\nhttps://github.com/itext/itextpdf/blob/develop/itext/src/main/java/com/itextpdf/text/pdf/security/PdfPKCS7.java\r\n```\r\n// When requested, go get and add the timestamp. May throw an exception.\r\n            // Added by Martin Brunecky, 07/12/2007 folowing Aiken Sam, 2006-11-15\r\n            // Sam found Adobe expects time-stamped SHA1-1 of the encrypted digest\r\n            if (tsaClient != null) {\r\n                byte[] tsImprint = tsaClient.getMessageDigest().digest(digest);\r\n                byte[] tsToken = tsaClient.getTimeStampToken(tsImprint);\r\n                if (tsToken != null) {\r\n                    ASN1EncodableVector unauthAttributes = buildUnauthenticatedAttributes(tsToken);\r\n                    if (unauthAttributes != null) {\r\n                        signerinfo.add(new DERTaggedObject(false, 1, new DERSet(unauthAttributes)));\r\n                    }\r\n                }\r\n            }\r\n\r\n```\r\nIn older standard https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_en/319100_319199/31914201/01.01.01_60/en_31914201v010101p.pdf (it was mentioned to use `SHA-1`\r\n\r\nbut now it is more flexible.\r\nLatest doc https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_ts/119500_119599/11953401/01.01.01_60/ts_11953401v010101p.pdf\r\nrefers to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5816 and allows to use more secure algorithms.\r\n\r\nAdobe has also `SHA-256` default in versions 9 onwards.\r\n\r\nI can create a PR for this, I need to know if there is any other reason for this not being done already.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":320,"updated_at":"2020-01-16T06:22:52Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":544977285,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":2,"closed_at":"2020-01-16T06:22:52Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":4,"+1":2,"rocket":1,"hooray":1,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/320/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"vic0075","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/6236263?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/vic0075","site_admin":false,"id":6236263,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjYyMzYyNjM=","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/vic0075/orgs"},"node_id":"MDU6SXNzdWU1NDQ5NzcyODU="},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2019-12- with displaying strings with composite fonts ","body":"There is a problem by drawing a string that contains various Unicode characters when using logical fonts for displaying. The reason is that it is not enough to check the availability of the glyph in the physical font, but it is necessary to check the presence of the character in the BaseFont used for drawing, since it doesn't know how the FontMapper is implemented.\r\nBugfix is proposed in the [PR 308](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/308).\r\nThe following code example may reproduce this problem (it should be displayed four symbols):\r\n\r\n    import java.awt.Color;\r\n    import java.awt.FontMetrics;\r\n    import java.awt.Graphics2D;\r\n    import java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\n    import java.io.IOException;\r\n    import java.util.HashMap;\r\n\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.Document;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.Font;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.DefaultFontMapper;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.DefaultFontMapper.BaseFontParameters;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfTemplate;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;\r\n\r\n    public class Test2 {\r\n\r\n    \tprivate static final float \tPAGE_A4_WIDTH_PX\t\t= 793.7007f;\r\n    \tprivate static final float \tPAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX\t\t= 1122.5196f;\r\n    \tprivate static final float\tTEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT\t= 400;\r\n    \tprivate static final String\tTESTED_TEXT\t\t\t\t= \"\\uff46\\u2080\\u0192\\u2081\";\r\n\t\r\n    \tpublic static void main(String[] args) {\r\n    \t\ttry (Document document = new Document()) {\r\n       \t\t\tPdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(\"test_pdf.pdf\"));\r\n    \t\t\tdocument.open();\r\n\r\n    \t\t\tPdfContentByte pdfContentByte = writer.getDirectContent();\r\n    \t\t\tdocument.setPageSize(new Rectangle(0, 0, PAGE_A4_WIDTH_PX, PAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX));\r\n    \t\t\tdocument.newPage();\r\n\r\n    \t\t\tPdfTemplate pdfTemplate = pdfContentByte.createTemplate(PAGE_A4_WIDTH_PX, PAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX);\r\n\r\n    \t\t\tGraphics2D g2D = pdfTemplate.createGraphics(TEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT, TEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT, createTestFontMapper());\r\n    \t\t\tg2D.setColor(Color.black);\r\n    \t\t\ttry {\r\n    \t\t\t\tjava.awt.Font logicalFont = new java.awt.Font(\"Dialog\", Font.NORMAL, 12);\r\n    \t\t\t\tg2D.setFont(logicalFont);\r\n    \t\t\t\tg2D.drawString(TESTED_TEXT, 15, 20);\r\n    \t\t\t} finally {\r\n    \t\t\t\tg2D.dispose();\r\n    \t\t\t}\r\n    \t\t\tpdfContentByte.addTemplate(pdfTemplate, 0, PAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX - TEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT);\r\n    \t\t} catch (DocumentException | IOException de) {\r\n    \t\t\tSystem.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n    \t\t}\r\n    \t}\r\n\t\r\n    \tprivate static DefaultFontMapper createTestFontMapper() {\r\n    \t\tDefaultFontMapper mapper = new DefaultFontMapper();\r\n    \tmapper.insertDirectory(sun.font.SunFontManager.getInstance().getPlatformFontPath(true));\r\n    \t\tHashMap<String, BaseFontParameters> mapping = mapper.getMapper();\r\n    \t\t/*\r\n    \t\t* Change encoding to the IDENTITY_H for the found fonts from the given platform font paht since\r\n    \t\t* the default implementation of the insertDirectory method use CP1252 encoding. But we\r\n    \t\t* need to display some unicode symbols. Dont know if there is a besser way to do this.\r\n    \t\t*/\r\n    \t\tfor (BaseFontParameters parameters : mapping.values()) {\r\n    \t\t\tparameters.encoding = BaseFont.IDENTITY_H;\r\n    \t\t}\r\n    \t\treturn mapper;\r\n    \t}\r\n with simulating bold font by drawing text","body":"There is a problem with simulating bold font by drawing text with the logical font if text cosists from the symbols from the different physical fonts (logical fonts always has suffix \".bold\" for the bold style and \".bolditalic\" for the bold & italic style).  Bugfix is proposed in the [PR 307](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/307).\r\nThe following code example may reproduce this problem:\r\n\r\n    import java.awt.Color;\r\n    import java.awt.FontMetrics;\r\n    import java.awt.Graphics2D;\r\n    import java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\n    import java.io.IOException;\r\n    import java.util.HashMap;\r\n\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.Document;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.Font;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.DefaultFontMapper;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.DefaultFontMapper.BaseFontParameters;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfTemplate;\r\n    import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;\r\n\r\n    public class Test {\r\n\r\n    \tprivate static final float \tPAGE_A4_WIDTH_PX\t\t= 793.7007f;\r\n    \tprivate static final float \tPAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX\t\t= 1122.5196f;\r\n    \tprivate static final float\tTEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT\t= 400;\r\n    \tprivate static final String\tTESTED_TEXT\t\t\t\t= \"Âä†Á≤óÂ≠óÈ´î Bold text\";\r\n\t\r\n    \tpublic static void main(String[] args) {\r\n    \t\ttry (Document document = new Document()) {\r\n    \t\t\tPdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(\"test_pdf.pdf\"));\r\n    \t\t\tdocument.open();\r\n\r\n    \t\t\tPdfContentByte pdfContentByte = writer.getDirectContent();\r\n    \t\t\tdocument.setPageSize(new Rectangle(0, 0, PAGE_A4_WIDTH_PX, PAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX));\r\n    \t\t\tdocument.newPage();\r\n\r\n    \t\t\tPdfTemplate pdfTemplate = pdfContentByte.createTemplate(PAGE_A4_WIDTH_PX, PAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX);\r\n\r\n    \t\t\tGraphics2D g2D = pdfTemplate.createGraphics(TEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT, TEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT, createTestFontMapper());\r\n    \t\t\tg2D.setColor(Color.black);\r\n    \t\t\ttry {\r\n    \t\t\t\tjava.awt.Font logicalFont = new java.awt.Font(\"Dialog\", Font.BOLD, 12);\r\n    \t\t\t\tjava.awt.Font phisicalFont = new java.awt.Font(\"SimSun\", Font.BOLD, 12);\r\n\t\t\t\t\r\n    \t\t\t\tint xOff = 15;\r\n    \t\t\t\tint yOff = 20;\r\n    \t\t\t\tyOff = drawString(g2D, null, \"Both followed string should be bold:\", xOff, yOff);\r\n    \t\t\t\tyOff = drawString(g2D, logicalFont, TESTED_TEXT, xOff, yOff);\r\n    \t\t\t\tyOff = drawString(g2D, phisicalFont, TESTED_TEXT, xOff, yOff);\r\n    \t\t\t} finally {\r\n    \t\t\t\tg2D.dispose();\r\n    \t\t\t}\r\n    \t\t\tpdfContentByte.addTemplate(pdfTemplate, 0, PAGE_A4_HEIGHT_PX - TEMPLATE_WIDTH_HEIGHT);\r\n    \t\t} catch (DocumentException | IOException de) {\r\n    \t\t\tSystem.err.println(de.getMessage());\r\n    \t\t}\r\n    \t}\r\n\t\r\n    \tprivate static DefaultFontMapper createTestFontMapper() {\r\n    \t\tDefaultFontMapper mapper = new DefaultFontMapper();\r\n\t\t    \r\n    mapper.insertDirectory(sun.font.SunFontManager.getInstance().getPlatformFontPath(true));\r\n    \t\tHashMap<String, BaseFontParameters> mapping = mapper.getMapper();\r\n    \t\t/*\r\n    \t\t* Change encoding to the IDENTITY_H for the found fonts from the given platform font paht since\r\n    \t\t* the default implementation of the insertDirectory method use CP1252 encoding. But we\r\n    \t\t* need to display some chinese symbols. Dont know if there is besser way to do this.\r\n    \t\t*/\r\n    \t\tfor (BaseFontParameters parameters : mapping.values()) {\r\n    \t\t\tparameters.encoding = BaseFont.IDENTITY_H;\r\n    \t\t}\r\n    \t\treturn mapper;\r\n    \t}\r\n\t\r\n    \tprivate static int drawString(Graphics2D g2D, java.awt.Font font, String text, int x, int y) {\r\n    \t\tif (font != null) {\r\n    \t\t\tg2D.setFont(font);\r\n    \t\t}\r\n    \t\tg2D.drawString(text, x, y);\r\n    \t\tint spaceBetweenTextLinesPx = 10;\r\n    \t\ty += getFontMetricsHeight(g2D, g2D.getFont()) + spaceBetweenTextLinesPx;\r\n    \t\treturn y;\r\n    \t}\r\n\r\n    \tprivate static int getFontMetricsHeight(Graphics2D g2D, java.awt.Font font) {\r\n    \t\tFontMetrics metrics = g2D.getFontMetrics(font);\r\n    \t\treturn metrics.getHeight();\r\n    \t}\r\n    } by calling PdfGraphics2D.translate(int,int) ","body":"After f73467c commit, calling the method translate(int,int) of the class PdfGraphics2D results in an StackOverflowError. Bugfix is proposed in the [306 PR](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/306).\r\nThe following code example may reproduce this error when uncommenting a line:\r\n\r\n    import java.awt.Color;\r\n world\";\r\n\t\r\n    \tpublic static void main(String[] args) {\r\n    \t\ttry (Document document = new Document()) {\r\n    \t\t\tPdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new fonts not working for Calibri ","body":"getFont method of FontFactoryImpl expects fontname, size, style. But doesn't consider style argument in case different bold font exists for provided font name, as per below code. \r\n   \r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6597998/70886308-2ff71700-2001-11ea-8544-03ffbe0b487e.png)\r\n\r\nSo with above condition if i use below code it will output normal style :\r\n`            Paragraph p1 = new Paragraph(new Chunk(\r\n                    \"This is my first paragraph. \",\r\n                    FontFactory.getFont(\"Calibri\", 10,Font.BOLD)));\r\n`\r\n\r\ngetFont fontname.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);`\r\n\r\nAbove was initialized in starting of method getFont, lowerCaseFontname  should be updated with new to be split by a pagebreak, so I use .setTableFitsPage(true);\r\nWhen this text/table is of some importance, I use a border and grey-filled background.\r\n\r\nNow rendering fills the rest of the page when the next table does not fit.\r\nIt seems to fill the page with a blank table with no background, but a border.\r\n\r\nI tried to put down some small code to demonstrate this behaviour, but all I get is not breaking within the cell (but the table) but also a border is created around the injected space ...\r\n\r\n```\r\npackage de.msg.vorsorge.test;\r\n\r\nimport java.awt.Color;\r\nimport os);\r\n\t\t\tdoc.open();\r\n\t\t\twriter.open();\r\n\t\t\taddElements(doc);\r\n\t\t\tdoc.close();\r\n\t\t\twriter.close();\r\n\t\t\tos.close();\r\n\t\t} catch (FileNotFoundException e) {\r\n\t\t\te.printStackTrace();\r\n\t\t} catch (IOException e) {\r\n\t\t\te.printStackTrace();\r\n\t\t}\r\n\t}\r\n\r\n\tprivate static void addElements(Document doc) {\r\n\t\tString text = \"Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisici elit, sed eiusmod tempor incidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequat. Quis aute iure reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint obcaecat cupiditat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.\";\r\n\r\n\t\tTable table = new Table(2);\r\n\t\ttable.setBorderWidth(0F);\r\n\t\ttable.enableBorderSide(Rectangle.BOX);\r\n\t\ttable.setOffset(5F);\r\n\t\ttable.setBackgroundColor(Color.BLUE);\r\n\t\ttable.setTableFitsPage(true);\r\n\t\ttable.addCell(new Cell(text));\r\n\t\ttable.addCell(new Cell(text));\r\n\t\tTable table2 = new Table(2);\r\n\t\ttable2.enableBorderSide(Rectangle.BOX);\r\n\t\ttable2.setTableFitsPage(true);\r\n\t\ttable2.addCell(new Cell(text));\r\n\t\ttable2.addCell(new Cell(text));\r\n\t\ttable2.addCell(new Cell(text));\r\n\t\ttable2.addCell(new Cell(text));\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\tdoc.add(table);\r\n\t\tdoc.add(new Phrase(text));\r\n\t\tdoc.add(new Phrase(text));\r\n\t\tdoc.add(table2);\r\n\t\tdoc.add(new Chunk(text));\r\n\t\tdoc.add(table);\r\n\t}\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nTo demonstrate what occurs in my project (herein Table is used by a class with som econvenience features ...), this is a part of the pdf: provider. The problem is that PDF contains invalid \"/ITXT\" which causes the failure,  because it is not whitelisted for use in Denmark .  Currently I'm using PdfBox as a workaround to remove it.\r\n\r\nThe cause of this issue is:\r\n- https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/master/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/PdfPages.java#L152  \r\n- https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/master/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/PdfStamperImp.java#L168\r\n\r\nCurrently I see few possible solutions:\r\n1. Remove it entirely. Please correct me if I'm wrong, but I do not see any benefit in having this item.\r\n1. Introduce mechanism or some parameters that would allow to control it.\r\n1. Move this item to more appropriate place e.g. as some metadata about document if PDF fails has such option. \r\n\r\nSteps to reproduce:\r\n1. nested lists with HTMLWorker","body":"The HTMLWorker.parseToList() method has a bug when parsing nested lists, e.g.\r\n```\r\n<ol>\r\n\t<li>Element-1\r\n\t\t<ol>\r\n\t\t\t<li>Element-1-1<\/li>\r\n\t\t\t<li>Element-1-2<\/li>\r\n\t\t<\/ol>\r\n\t<\/li>\r\n\t<li>Element-2\r\n\t\t<ol>\r\n\t\t\t<li>Element-2-1<\/li>\r\n\t\t\t<li>Element-2-2<\/li>\r\n\t\t<\/ol>\r\n\t<\/li>\r\n<\/ol>\r\n```\r\nAs a result, only the first-level elements are returned: ['Element-1', 'Element-2'].\r\n\r\nThe bug is in the HTMLWorker.endElement() method:\r\n```\r\n542: \tif (tag.equals(HtmlTags.UNORDEREDLIST)\r\n543:\t\t|| tag.equals(HtmlTags.ORDEREDLIST)) {\r\n...\r\n558:\t((TextElementArray) stack.peek()).add((Element) obj);\r\n```\r\nFor nested lists, variable 'obj' is of type 'com.lowagie.text.List', but it is casted to type 'Element'. Therefore the method 'add(Element o)' is called, but this method does not handle lists. \r\nThe proper method is 'add(List nested)' in class 'com.lowagie.text.List'. So the above code should look like this:\r\n```\r\n558:\t{\r\n559:\t\tObject peek = stack.peek();\r\n560:\t\tif (peek instanceof com.lowagie.text.List && obj instanceof com.lowagie.text.List) {\r\n561:\t\t\t((com.lowagie.text.List) peek).add((com.lowagie.text.List) obj);\r\n562:\t\t}\r\n563:\t\telse \r\n564:\t\t{\r\n565:\t\t\t((TextElementArray) peek).add((Element) obj);\r\n566:\t\t}                  \r\n567:\t}\r\n\r\n```\r\nPlease fix this bug so we can use the official version again. Thank you in advance.\r\n\r\nBest regards\r\nMichael","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":288,"updated_at":"2020-01-17T06:34:56Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":508930244,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":2,"closed_at":"2020-01-17T06:34:56Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":1,"+1":1,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/288/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"rammetzger","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/55376482?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/rammetzger","site_admin":false,"id":55376482,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjU1Mzc2NDgy","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/rammetzger/orgs"},"node_id":"MDU6SXNzdWU1MDg5MzAyNDQ= not visible in Paragraph if keepTogether is set to true","body":"First and foremost I would like apologize if this is not a place for this question. Essentially I'm repeating the question I asked a while ago on [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57787275/why-is-pdfptable-not-visible-in-paragraph-if-keeptogether-is-set-to-true).\r\n\r\nI'm trying to group table with two texts (one above, and one below table) to prevent splitting of elements when they don't fit in remaining empty space on page.\r\n\r\nElements are added to Paragraph with _keepTogether_ set to true. I noticed peculiar behavior when using _setKeepTogether(true)_.\r\n\r\n[If _setKeepTogether(true)_ is called, table won't appear, other elements will.](https://i.stack.imgur.com/43Q48.png)\r\n[If _setKeepTogether(false)_ - everything works as expected.](https://i.stack.imgur.com/ehYBE.png)\r\n\r\nHere is my code example:\r\n```java\r\npublic static void main(String[] args) throws DocumentException, FileNotFoundException {\r\n  Document document = new Document();\r\n  PdfWriter pdfWriter = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(DEST));\r\n  document.open();\r\n\r\n  PdfPTable table = new PdfPTable(2);\r\n  table.addCell(\"Lorem\");\r\n  table.addCell(\"ipsum\");\r\n  table.addCell(\"dolor\");\r\n  table.addCell(\"sit\");\r\n\r\n  Paragraph mainParagraph = new Paragraph();\r\n  Paragraph paragraph1 = new Paragraph(\"Text above table\");\r\n  Paragraph paragraph2 = new Paragraph(\"Text below table\");\r\n\r\n  mainParagraph.add(paragraph1);\r\n  mainParagraph.add(table);\r\n  mainParagraph.add(paragraph2);\r\n\r\n  // if keeptogether is true, table is not visible\r\n  mainParagraph.setKeepTogether(true);\r\n\r\n  document.add(mainParagraph);\r\n\r\n  document.close();\r\n}\r\n```\r\nAny clue as to what is happening?\r\n\r\nCode is tested with latest (1.3.11) OpenPdf version and openjdk 1.8.0_192.\r\n\r\nFor what it's worth I also tested with itext 2.1.7 and 5.5.13. Version 2.1.7 has the same problem and in 5.5.13 table is visible with _keepTogether_ set to true. bottom height calculation in table cell","body":"For long texts (more than one page) within a table cell, it can happen that a line is printed twice. One time on the last page and one time on the next. The cause is an incorrect calculation of the available cell height.\r\n\r\nThe bug is in the calculation of cell height in class PdfPRow on lines 609-612:\r\n```\r\nfloat bottom = cell.getTop() + cell.getEffectivePaddingBottom() - newHeight;\r\nfloat top = cell.getTop() - cell.getEffectivePaddingTop();\r\n```\r\nThe bottom value does not consider EffectivePaddingTop. The code should look something like this:\r\n```\r\nfloat top = cell.getTop() - cell.getEffectivePaddingTop();\r\nfloat bottom = top + cell.getEffectivePaddingBottom() - newHeight;\r\n```\r\n\r\nPlease take over the correction in one of the next versions.\r\nThanks in advance.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/258/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":258,"updated_at":"2021-12-14T15:04:54Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/258/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":493870854,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/258/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":4,"closed_at":"2019-09-16T15:44:44Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/258","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="},{"default":true,"color":"128A0C","name":"help bug concerning stroke colors when simulating bold fonts.","body":"I've encountered a bug in PdfGraphics2D#drawString() when simulating a bold font. It is quite hard to find an easily reproducible example, but I hope static code analysis is clear enough in this case.\r\n\r\nUntil now, when simulating a bold font, the stroke color is changed by using PdfContentByte#setColorStroke(). Unfortunately, this means that the value of paintStroke is not updated in PdfGraphics2D. This incorrect state of paintStroke only will have an effect if the next time the stroke color is used it is expected to have the same color as it had before cb.setColorStroke() was called. OpenPDF then assumes the desired color has already been set and doesn't change it again, leading to elements painted in an unexpected color.\r\n\r\nUsing setStrokePaint() instead fixes this bug because it takes care of maintaining the correct state.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/220/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":220,"updated_at":"2019-08-13T06:01:44Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/220/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":478299808,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/220/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/220.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/220","merged_at":"2019-08-08T09:34:50Z","diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/220.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/220"},"state_reason":null,"comments":4,"closed_at":"2019-08-08T09:34:50Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/220","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="},{"default":true,"color":"128A0C","name":"help metadata be cleaned or maintained by default in pdfstamper?","body":"The Pull Request #179 clean metadata from resulting pdf files by default.\r\n\r\n\r\nAs noted by @ngs-software, it can cause issues as changes default behavior and some software need the metadata (for indexing purposes)\r\n\r\nWe have been experiencing issues when signing documents with keywords/metadata previously injected in a document, as these become inaccessible through API after document is stamped.\r\n\r\nAs far as we have seen, this is due to this pull request, as it make keywords hidden when stamping, removing  references to existing kewords in the document (event if the actual keywords content is still present inside it - can be seen with a regular text editor).\r\n\r\nWe'd like to know what is the purpose of this modification, and if it responds to any compliance or standard rule we don't know about. From our point of view, metadata cleanup should be offered and some kind of utility helper/class to be used only when required as part of external business logic requirements, and not as a default behavior, as it may be required later for multiple purposes.\r\n\r\nWe include for your examination 3 pdf files:\r\n\r\n- Original File with metadata keywords added to it, that can be seen from Reader application.\r\n- File resulting from signing original file through a unit test with OpenPDF 1.2.15, where metadata is still visible from Reader application.\r\n- File resulting from signing original file through the same unit test with OpenPDF 1.2.16, where metadata disappears from Reader application (but can be seen in document through text editor).\r\n\r\nFrom this analysis, we believe that this modification should be rolled-back and 'refactored' to a helper method that, by the way, should perform a complete cleanup of keywords, in case that's the actual requirement, as in current approach, apart of deleting existing information of original document without request from outer application, it only makes it hidden (but still present in pdf's raw contents).\r\n\r\nLooking forward to your comments and considerations,\r\n\r\nBest Regards,\r\nngs\r\n\r\n[signed-with-1.2.15.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/3451046/signed-with-1.2.15.pdf)\r\n[signed-with-1.2.16.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/3451047/signed-with-1.2.16.pdf)\r\n[original.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/3451048/original.pdf)\r\n\r\n_Originally NullPointerException for OTF Fonts","body":"I've encountered a bug creating a PDF out of HTML when using OTF fonts as a `@font-face` CSS directive via flying-saucer.\r\n\r\nI'm not yet sure why this happens with some OTF fonts, but I could reproduce and fix the bug.\r\n\r\nSteps to reproduce:\r\n\r\nFetch the \"D-DIN\" font from https://fontlibrary.org/de/font/d-din. Download ZIP, choose D-DIN.otf. I could reproduce it with a variety of other OTF fonts, but this should serve as an example.\r\n\r\nConvert the following HTML:\r\n\r\n```html\r\n<!DOCTYPE html>\r\n<html lang=\"de\">\r\n<head>\r\n  <meta charset=\"utf-8\" />\r\n  <style>\r\n    @font-face {\r\n      font-family: \"D-DIN\";\r\n      src: url('file:/path/to/D-DIN.otf');\r\n      -fs-pdf-font-embed: embed;\r\n      -fs-pdf-font-encoding: Identity-H;\r\n      font-weight: normal;\r\n      font-style: normal;\r\n    }\r\n    body {\r\n      font-family: \"D-DIN\";\r\n    }\r\n  <\/style>\r\n<\/head>\r\n<body>\r\n  <h1>Test<\/h1>\r\n<\/body>\r\n<\/html>\r\n```\r\n\r\nto a PDF. I've been using flying-saucer (https://github.com/flyingsaucerproject/flyingsaucer) which uses OpenPDF as one of its backends.\r\n\r\nThe code to create the PDF with flyingsaucer:\r\n\r\n```java\r\npackage test;\r\n\r\nimport org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer;\r\n\r\nimport java.io.File;\r\nimport java.io.FileNotFoundException;\r\nimport java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.IOException;\r\nimport java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;\r\nimport java.nio.file.Files;\r\nimport java.nio.file.Paths;\r\nimport java.util.stream.Stream;\r\n\r\npublic class Fixture {\r\n    private static String readLines(String filePath)\r\n    {\r\n        StringBuilder contentBuilder = new StringBuilder();\r\n        try (Stream<String> stream = Files.lines( Paths.get(filePath), StandardCharsets.UTF_8))\r\n        {\r\n            stream.forEach(s -> contentBuilder.append(s).append(\"\\n\"));\r\n        }\r\n        catch (IOException e)\r\n        {\r\n            e.printStackTrace();\r\n        }\r\n        return contentBuilder.toString();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    private static void buildPDF(String htmlContent) {\r\n        try {\r\n            ITextRenderer renderer = new ITextRenderer();\r\n            renderer.setDocumentFromString(htmlContent);\r\n            renderer.layout();\r\n            renderer.createPDF(new FileOutputStream(new File(\"/path/to/output.pdf\")));\r\n            renderer.finishPDF();\r\n        } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {\r\n            e.printStackTrace();\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\r\n         String content = readLines(\"/path/to/fixture.html\");\r\n         buildPDF(content);\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nCurrently, OpenPDF gives me a NullPointerException:\r\n\r\n```\r\njava.lang.NullPointerException\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.CFFFont.<init>(CFFFont.java:1103)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.CFFFontSubset.<init>(CFFFontSubset.java:174)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.TrueTypeFontUnicode.writeFont(TrueTypeFontUnicode.java:419)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.FontDetails.writeFont(FontDetails.java:317)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter.addSharedObjectsToBody(PdfWriter.java:1236)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter.close(PdfWriter.java:1170)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfDocument.close(PdfDocument.java:833)\r\n        at com.lowagie.text.Document.close(Document.java:452)\r\n        at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.createPDF(ITextRenderer.java:337)\r\n        at org.xhtmlrenderer.pdf.ITextRenderer.createPDF(ITextRenderer.java:265)\r\n[...]\r\n```\r\n\r\nAfter applying the patch in this PR, it works again with all the fonts that caused issues. I also tested with a variety of TTF fonts.\r\n\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/214/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":214,"updated_at":"2019-08-01T05:25:45Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/214/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":475208226,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/214/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/214.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/214","merged_at":"2019-08-01T05:25:45Z","diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/214.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/214"},"state_reason":null,"comments":1,"closed_at":"2019-08-01T05:25:45Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/214","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/214/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/214","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/214/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"nethad","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/nethad/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/222981?v=4","events_url":"https://api.git wrapping attack","body":"iText 2.1.7 and OpenPDF too is affected by a signature wrapping attack. (For details see https://pdf-insecurity.org/).\r\n\r\nProblem:\r\nOpenPDF just uses the last part of the ByteRange to calculate the length a signature. \r\n\r\nProposed solution:\r\nInstead one should take the length of all parts (first signed part, unsigned part which must contain only the signature, and the second signed part). \r\n\r\nSee: AcroFields#getSignatureNames\r\n\r\nAs an example, this document passes all checks:\r\n\r\nhttps://pdf-insecurity.org/download/exploits/3_eXpert_PDF_12_Ultimate/siwa.pdf\r\n\r\nThis should return false instead of true: AcroFields#signatureCoversWholeDocument\r\n\r\nDoes anybody see a problem with the supposed solution? If not I can provide a 001 java8 generics","body":"Hello.\r\nI did a refactoring on the project to make use of typed generics all over the place.\r\nSome changes may have a minor impact on the preservation of the current API.\r\n\r\nIn particular, the class Phrase used to extend ArrayList. It's mostly impossible to keep this structure, because using a typed ArrayList (something like 'class Phrase extends ArrayList') creates some clashes between the ArrayList bridge method and other similar methods in the API.\r\nSo, I decided to change the signature of the class and make the ArrayList a field of the class (this also make encapsulation more explicit).\r\nPlease review it.\r\n\r\nPlease also note that I didn't have the opportunity to do extensive review of the code and proper dependencies","body":"I suggest reducing dependencies used by openpdf, in order that fewer users have to resolve version conflicts between dependencies and to help users who don't have clean dependency management. (See [this example](https://dzone.com/articles/10-effective-tips-on-using-maven) recommending to explicitly repeat transitive dependencies in their pom, forgetting in my opinion that it will defeat your library updating its dependencies when it's needed.)\r\n\r\nFor that, I have located three commits adding dependencies which I think don't have a good enough reason to be added in openpdf:\r\n- https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/commit/7b2a602fd627eeba69b7aa030551d8ed4cd672d7#comments\r\n- https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/commit/8ad6e9bf012d67eb4149bb8064cf8df8f13d3a63#comments\r\n- https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/commit/fb4ec297b0e6a555ece9166183f905068c89bf2f#comments\r\n\r\nFor juniversalchardet and commons-compress dependencies, it is a bit less obvious if they have, or not, a good enough reason to be added (such as fixing bugs), so I do not have a strong opinion on them at the moment.\r\nThat said, commons-compress has more risks to have version conflicts than juniversalchardet, so if the only reason is to remove the LZWDecoder class used in PdfReader then I would debate font style when concatenating Phrases","body":"When creating a _Phrase_ and then adding another _Phrase_ to it with _add(Object o)_ method, the second _Phrase_ gets the sum of the font styles of the first and second _Phrase_, e.g.\r\n\r\n```\r\nFont headerFont = FontFactory.getFont(\"Trebuchet MS\", 10, Font.BOLD);\r\nheaderFont.setStyle(Font.BOLD); // Reapply style to circumvent issue #106\r\nFont headerItalicFont = FontFactory.getFont(\"Trebuchet MS\", 10, Font.ITALIC);\r\nheaderItalicFont.setStyle(Font.ITALIC);\r\n\r\nPhrase p1 = new Phrase(\"First text\", headerFont);\r\np1.add(new Phrase(\" - Second text\", headerItalicFont);\r\n```\r\n\r\nwould result in:\r\n**First text _- Second text_**\r\n\r\nwhile the intention is to get:\r\n**First text** _- Second text_\r\n\r\nThe problem occurs in _Font.difference(Font font)_ method at the last line of the following part:\r\n```\r\n\t\tif (style1 != UNDEFINED || style2 != UNDEFINED) {\r\n\t\t\tif (style1 == UNDEFINED)\r\n\t\t\t\tstyle1 = 0;\r\n\t\t\tif (style2 == UNDEFINED)\r\n\t\t\t\tstyle2 = 0;\r\n\t\t\tdStyle = style1 | style2;\r\n\t\t}\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe method returns a new _Font_ with style _dStyle_, where _style1_ is the style of first _Phrase_ and _style2_ is the style of second _Phrase_ being added.\r\n\r\nThis problem didn't appear in iText 2.1.7. It can be circumvented by reapplying the correct style to the added _Phrase_ afterwards.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":107,"updated_at":"2020-07-02T12:54:33Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":359474279,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":7,"closed_at":"2020-07-02T12:54:32Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/107/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"jjkarppi","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/42967532?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jjkarppi/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/jjkarppi","site_admin":false,"id":42967532, style gets ignored when instantiating a new font","body":"When a new font is created using _FontFactory.getFont()_ with _style_ as one parameter, the style parameter gets ignored and _Font.NORMAL_ style gets applied. E.g.\r\n\r\n`FontFactory.registerDirectories();`\r\n`Font titleFont = FontFactory.getFont(\"Trebuchet MS\", 16, Font.BOLD);`\r\n\r\nresults in that _titleFont_ style is _Font.NORMAL_ (value 0) instead of _Font.BOLD_ (value 1).\r\n\r\nDebugging, this the error seems to happen in _FontFactoryImp.getFont(String fontname, String encoding, boolean embedded, float size, int style, Color color, boolean cached)_ here:\r\n\r\n`if (style != Font.UNDEFINED && found) {`\r\n`    style &= ~fs;`\r\n`}`\r\n\r\nIf I understand correctly, _style_ and _fs_ have the same value inside this _if_ clause, and therefore a bitwise AND operation on a value and its complement always results in 0, which is the value for _Font.NORMAL_.\r\n\r\nThis bug didn't exist in iText 2.1.7. It can be circumvented by applying the desired style after the font is created, e.g.\r\n\r\n`FontFactory.registerDirectories();`\r\n`Font titleFont = FontFactory.getFont(\"Trebuchet MS\", 16, Font.BOLD); // Style becomes NORMAL here`\r\n`titleFont.setStyle(Font.BOLD); // Style becomes BOLD`","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/106/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":106,"updated_at":"2018-12-13T11:37:48Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/106/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":359439823,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/106/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":3,"closed_at":"2018-12-02T11:05:15Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/106","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="},{"default":true,"color":"128A0C","name":"help cleanup (Add library dependencies, remove old custom code)","body":"This is part of the ongoing work on Issue #89, where the source code is cleaned up, old custom source code is replaced by using software libraries instead. \r\n\r\n- Add dependency to Apache Commons commons-text. Remove SimpleXMLParser.escapeXML. \r\n- Deprecate SimpleXMLParser. Should use a XML parser from a library instead from now on.\r\n- Removed ExceptionConverter. Added simpler ExceptionUtil class.\r\n- Add dependency to Apache Commons IO and Apache Commons Compress. Remove the LZWDecoder class.\r\n- Add dependency on Sanselan (Apache Commons Imaging) and use that to load images. Remove old custom BMP, GIF, PNG, TIF and JBIG image codecs.\r\n- Removed the pdf-rtf module.\r\n- Remove the class BidiOrder. Remove support for bidirectional text support.\r\n\r\nAs a result of this the contents of misc_licenses.txt is reduced considerably, making OpenPDF significantly more LGPL/MPL consistent. The only remaining class mentioned there now is SimpleXMLParser. That class is very-non-trivial to replace, and it is still in use in iText, so it should be safe.\r\n\r\nI intend to merge this pull-request in some days if there are no strong
