mono PNG with color ICC profile displays wrong","body":"Although it doesn't make a lot of sense to me, a monochrome PNG (1 component) might have a color ICC profile (3 components). One way to create a file like that is to use GhostScript and ImageMagick:\r\n\r\n* Start with a black-and-white text PDF\r\n* Use GhostScript to render to color PNG: `gs -sDEVICE=png256 -o test.png test.pdf`\r\n* Use ImageMagick to convert to B&W PNG: `convert test.png test2.png`\r\n\r\nHere's such an image. It displays fine in any browser:\r\n[test2.png](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3847609/38220183-b6c889f8-368d-11e8-9eb1-4a1e6a8f28ec.png)\r\n\r\nBut when importing it into a PDF with `Image.getInstance`, it displays incorrectly, because the raster is 1-component but the /ColorSpace is 3-component:\r\n[out.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/1869625/out.pdf)\r\n\r\nThis problem occurs with PNGs, but not with TIFFs (the TiffImage class ignores an ICC if its `getNumComponents()` doesn't match).","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":73,"updated_at":"2018-09-13T11:15:44Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":310639834,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":3,"closed_at":"2018-09-13T11:15:44Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/73/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"jeffrey-easyesi","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/3847609?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easyesi/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/jeffrey-easyesi","site_admin":false,"id":3847609,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjM4NDc2MDk=","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/jeffrey-easy this.certificate = certificate;\r\n-        this.crlList = crlList;\r\n+    this.crl = crl;\r\n         this.filter = filter;\r\n     }\r\n```\r\n\r\nAs far as the change goes I guess it's fine, because the array was never used for anything more than `[0]` but it breaks binary compatibility with itext-4.2.0 for no real reason.\r\nI would suggest adding a method such as:\r\n\r\n```Java\r\n  /**\r\n   * Sets the cryptographic parameters.\r\n   * @deprecated use {@link #setCrypto(PrivateKey, X509Certificate, CRL, PdfName)}\r\n   */\r\n  public void setCrypto(PrivateKey privKey, Certificate[] certChain, CRL[] crlList, PdfName filter) {\r\n    setCrypto(privKey, (X509Certificate) certChain[0], crlList != null ? crlList[0] : null, filter);\r\n  }\r\n```\r\n\r\nTell me if you'd like a PR for due to missing trailer (on bad startxref?)","body":"In 1.0.5, we got a NullPointerException with the following stacktrace while trying to read a PDF:\r\n\r\n```\r\nPdfReader.java:1112 - com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.readPages\r\nPdfReader.java:622 - com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.readPdf\r\nPdfReader.java:282 - com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.\r\nPdfReader.java:295 - com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfReader.\r\n```\r\n\r\nBased on the line numbers, `trailer` must be null. Tracing through the execution, this can happen in the following sequence of events:\r\n\r\n1. `readPdf` calls `readXref`, which is supposed to set `trailer` (among other things).\r\n2. `readXref` doesn't find a valid `startxref` and throws an exception, or `readXrefSection` throws an exception due to an invalid `xref`.\r\n3. `readPdf` catches the exception and calls `rebuildXref`\r\n4. That method tries to set the `trailer`, too, but it can return without actually setting it.\r\n5. `readPdf` proceeds to `readPages`, `trailer` is unset, and we get an NPE.\r\n\r\nI'm not sure what the proper fix would be, though. Should one of the caught exceptions instead bubble out of `readPdf`? Should `rebuildXref` set `trailer` to an empty `PdfDictionary` if it doesn't find the actual trailer?\r\n\r\nSorry, I'm pretty ignorant about the PDF format in general. This report is just based on working through this exception's execution makes no distinctions between reading password vs editing password","body":"I have a PDF that is password protected for editing (PDF/A compatible PDF), but can be read without password. If you open Acrobat Reader, go to File -> Properties -> Security -> Show Details.., you can see that there are actually two passwords possible and only for editing it is enabled. Acrobat can even force the PDF to be editable without password, losing the PDF/A compatibility in the process. So either way, a password protected PDF should be viewable in OpenPDF.\r\n\r\nOpenPDF detects that the document is encrypted, but since I don't have a password it fails the following check:\r\n\r\n```java\r\npublic final boolean isOpenedWithFullPermissions() {\r\n  return !encrypted || ownerPasswordUsed;\r\n}\r\n```\r\nI can open the PDF in other readers just fine as long as I don't enable editing mode. In OpenPDF I would expect something like the following check instead:\r\n```java\r\npublic final boolean isOpenedWithFullPermissions() {\r\n  return !encrypted || ownerPasswordUsed || (!pdfRequiresReadingPassword && readonlyMode);\r\n}\r\n```\r\nIf I force this method to return `true`, it actually is able to read the PDF without issues (this is my current workaround, unfortunately).","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":35,"updated_at":"2020-08-07T07:45:17Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":247052808,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":5,"closed_at":"2018-07-17T18:59:34Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/35/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"bbottema","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/2115718?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bbottema/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/bbottema","site_admin":false,"id":2115718,"grava fixes and improvements","body":"I recently became aware of this fork, and a request that I consider submitting changes to it. I undid some code reformatting, and reapplied my changes. I intend to use this fork going forward, but I do need these changes.\r\n\r\nThis pull request is the set of changes that I made since you forked from me. They could be broken up into separate requests, I suppose, but they are pretty minimal and should be non-controversial (I hope).\r\n\r\n+ A few changes are to the modified text extraction that I had written:\r\n    +  I now return an empty string rather than null if there is no text in a document.\r\n\r\n    + Text extraction returns markup representing the area taken by a word; this is now given with less precision, as results were very large, and the extra digits represented micrometers or less.\r\n\r\n    + Marked sections that don't represent markup elements, and have no names or attributes are silently omitted (as they are useless). This is a more precise version of the policy to suppress \"artifacts\" (text that would not be appropriate for a screen reader).\r\n\r\nI removed detection of missing \"trailers\" in a PDF, as they are not required by the standard  any longer.\r\n\r\nFixed an NPE on a bad font object, as well as some potential type issues.\r\n\r\nThe tokenizer would crash when finding permitted (but useless) stray spaces in hex constants; I did find PDFs \"in the wild\" that had such spaces. Now they are yet.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":20,"updated_at":"2017-06-05T14:57:17Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":210039788,"state":"closed","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20/timeline","state_reason":"completed","comments":0,"closed_at":"2017-06-05T14:57:17Z","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/20/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"ghost","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/10137?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/ghost","site_admin":false,"id":10137,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEwMTM3","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/ghost/orgs"},"node_id":"MDU6SXNzdWUyMTAwMzk3ODg="},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2017-02-15T09:47:26Z","title":"Issue closed: LGPL license","body":"The [readme](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/master/README.md) says that this fork is based on _iText 4_, but to be precise:\r\n\r\n* [iText 2.1.7](https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/releases/tag/2.1.7) (7 Jul 2009) was the last MPL/LGPL release by [iText Software](http://itextpdf.com/).\r\n* `4.2.0` was an internal SVN tag, used to sync up versions between [iText (Java)](https://github.com/itext/itextpdf) and [iTextSharp (.NET)](https://github.com/itext/itextsharp). The latter was at `4.1.6` [at that point](https://github.com/itext/itextsharp/commit/1d0520c6c2e6792fa0599f1386047454093036b6). However, iText Software never released a build based on the `4.2.0` tag. It was a mid-development construct and the software wasn't guaranteed to be stable at that point. When iText migrated from SVN to Git, some technical constructs were cleaned up (by me personally, see full disclosure below), including the internal `4.2.0` tag. As far as iText Software concerns, there never was a release of \"iText 4\".\r\n  * [2.1.7-59-g935969371a](https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/commit/935969371a) (27 November 2009) was the last pre-AGPL commit and corresponds with the former `4.2.0` tag in SVN.\r\n  * [2.1.7-60-gf69dd81b2e](https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/commit/f69dd81b2e) (1 December 2009) is where the AGPL headers were added\r\n* [iText 5.0.0](https://github.com/itext/itextpdf/releases/tag/5.0.0) (8 December  2009) was the first AGPL release by iText Software.\r\n* On 31 August 2010, GitHub user [ymasory](https://github.com/ymasory) uploaded a version of iText \"MPL/LGPL\" to Github. It is unclear if this was based on `2.1.7` or on `2.1.7-59-g935969371a`. They did not accept pull requests or did any other development.\r\n* On 19 September 2012, a now-defunct New York software startup called [InProTopia Corporation](https://github.com/weiyeh/iText-4.2.0/blob/master/pom.xml#L24) (as far as I can tell, founded by a student of the Columbia University) took ymasory's repo and used that to upload a Maven build of \"iText 4.2.0\" and \"iText 4.2.1\" to Maven Central. However, they used (or hijacked?) `com.lowagie` as `GroupId`, which they were not allowed to do according to [Apache's Guide to uploading artifacts to the Central Repository](https://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-central-repository-upload.html). This is explained in a blog post on iText's website: http://itextpdf.com/maven-update-problem-with-itext-4.2.2. See also this Stack Overflow answer: http://stackoverflow.com/a/14213851/766786\r\n* For clarity of this overview, I skipped some of the intermediate forks.\r\n\r\nConclusion: this project should do it's due diligence and make absolutely sure what it is based upon: is it iText **2.1.7** or is it iText **2.1.7-59-g935969371a**? I don't want to sound like I'm spreading FUD, but you need to make absolutely sure that your users aren't in uncharted territory.\r\n\r\nAs a side note (maybe this should be a separate issue?), if you ever plan to upload to Maven Central, then you need to change every reference to `com.lowagie` to something else, as described in the link above.\r\n\r\nI recommend that you contact [Software Freedom Conservancy](https://sfconservancy.org/) for legal and technical advice. They have extensive experience with community developers taking over an Open Source project after a license change. \r\n\r\n**Full disclosure**: I am QA & Release Engineer at iText Software, but I've been an Open Source user & advocate since decades before I joined iText Software. From a personal point of view, I wish this project good luck because it is 8 years behind in development. The fact that I took considerable time to do my research for this issue, should give you a clue that I don't want to intentionally harm this project. From a professional point of view, I welcome the competition. It keeps us on edge. OSGi mappings for all projects","body":"This will add `Export-Package` and `Import-Package` entries to the generated JAR files' MANIFEST.MF files, allowing to deploy the libraries as OSGi bundles on application servers supporting OSGi.\r\n\r\nThe Bouncycastle dependencies have been marked as optional, since they are only required for some use cases, and don't have to be deployed if that functionality is not used.\r\n\r\nThis is something that I need for our deployment case, and a few other people have asked for this as well, e.g. here: http://itext.2136553.n4.nabble.com/itext-as-OSGi-bundle-td3448295.html\r\n\r\nAn older version of iText was available as an OSGi bundle through Springsource: http://ebr.springsource.com/repository/app/bundle/version/detail?name=com.springsource.com.lowagie.text&version=2.0.8&searchType=bundlesByName&searchQuery=iText\r\n\r\nThis PR provides the same functionality with regards to the generated Manifest.\r\n\r\nThe bundle plugin is defined and used for all of the projects, but the important change is in the OpenPDF project, where the Bouncycastle dependencies are declared as optional. For the other projects, the default configuration from the parent project is used.\r\n\r\nThe Manifest for the OpenPDF JAR now includes the following section:\r\n\r\n```\r\nBundle-Description: Open and Free PDF library.\r\nBundle-License: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html, http://www.mozill\r\n a.org/MPL/2.0/\r\nBundle-ManifestVersion: 2\r\nBundle-Name: openpdf\r\nBundle-SymbolicName: Fix Temporary File Information Disclosure Vulnerability\n","body":"\n# Security Vulnerability Fix\n\nThis pull request fixes a Temporary File Information Disclosure Vulnerability, which existed in this project.\n\n## Preamble\n\nThe system temporary directory is shared between all users on most unix-like systems (not MacOS, or Windows). Thus, code interacting with the system temporary directory must be careful about file interactions in this directory, and must ensure that the correct file posix permissions are set.\n\nThis PR was generated because a call to `File.createTempFile(..)` was detected in this repository in a way that makes this project vulnerable to local information disclosure.\nWith the default uname configuration, `File.createTempFile(..)` creates a file with the permissions `-rw-r--r--`. This means that any other user on the system can read the contents of this file.\n\n### Impact\n\nInformation in this file is visible to other local users, allowing a malicious actor co-resident on the same machine to view potentially sensitive files.\n\n#### Other Examples\n\n - [CVE-2020-15250](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-269g-pwp5-87pp) - junit-team/junit\n - [CVE-2021-21364](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hpv8-9rq5-hq7w) - swagger-api/swagger-codegen\n - [CVE-2022-24823](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5mcr-gq6c-3hq2) - netty/netty\n - [CVE-2022-24823](https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-269q-hmxg-m83q) - netty/netty\n\n# The Fix\n\nThe fix has been to convert the logic above to use the following API that was introduced in Java 1.7.\n\n```java\nFile tmpDir = Files.createTempFile(\"temp dir\").toFile();\n```\n\nThe API both creates the file securely, ie. with a random, non-conflicting name, with file permissions that only allow the currently executing user to read or write the contents of this file.\nBy default, `Files.createTempFile(\"temp dir\")` will create a file with the permissions `-rw-------`, which only allows the user that created the file to view/write the file contents.\n\n# :arrow_right: Vulnerability Disclosure :arrow_left:\n\n:wave: Vulnerability disclosure is a super important part of the vulnerability handling process and should not be skipped! This may be completely new to you, and that's okay, I'm here to assist!\n\nFirst question, do we need to perform vulnerability disclosure? It depends!\n\n 1. Is the vulnerable code only in tests or example code? No disclosure required!\n 2. Is the vulnerable code in code shipped to your end users? Vulnerability disclosure is probably required!\n\n## Vulnerability Disclosure How-To\n\nYou have a few options options to perform vulnerability disclosure. However, I'd like to suggest the following 2 options:\n\n 1. Request a CVE number from GitHub by creating a repository-level [GitHub Security Advisory](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/repository-security-advisories/creating-a-repository-security-advisory). This has the advantage that, if you provide sufficient information, GitHub will automatically generate Dependabot alerts for your downstream consumers, resolving this vulnerability more quickly.\n 2. Reach out to the team at Snyk to assist with CVE issuance. They can be reached at the [Snyk's Disclosure Email](mailto:report@snyk.io).\n\n## Detecting this and Future Vulnerabilities\n\nThis vulnerability was automatically detected by GitHub's CodeQL using this [CodeQL Query](https://codeql.github.com/codeql-query-help/java/java-local-temp-file-or-directory-information-disclosure/).\n\nYou can automatically detect future vulnerabilities like this by enabling the free (for open-source) [GitHub Action](https://github.com/github/codeql-action).\n\nI'm not an employee of GitHub, I'm simply an open-source security researcher.\n\n## Source\n\nThis contribution was automatically generated with an [OpenRewrite](https://github.com/openrewrite/rewrite) [refactoring recipe](https://docs.openrewrite.org/), which was lovingly hand crafted to bring this security fix to your repository.\n\nThe source code that generated this PR can be found here:\n[SecureTempFileCreation](https://github.com/openrewrite/rewrite-java-security/blob/main/src/main/java/org/openrewrite/java/security/SecureTempFileCreation.java)\n\n## Opting-Out\n\nIf you'd like to opt-out of future automated security vulnerability fixes like this, please consider adding a file called\n`.github/GH-ROBOTS.txt` to your repository with the line:\n\n```\nUser-agent: JLLeitschuh/security-research\nDisallow: *\n```\n\nThis bot will respect the [ROBOTS.txt](https://moz.com/learn/seo/robotstxt) format for future contributions.\n\nAlternatively, if this project is no longer actively maintained, consider [archiving](https://help.github.com/en/github/creating-cloning-and-archiving-repositories/about-archiving-repositories) the repository.\n\n## CLA Requirements\n\n_This section is only relevant if your project requires contributors to sign a Contributor License Agreement (CLA) for external contributions._\n\nIt is unlikely that I'll be able to directly sign CLAs. However, all contributed commits are already automatically signed-off.\n\n> The meaning of a signoff depends on the project, but it typically certifies that committer has the rights to submit this work under the same license and agrees to a Developer Certificate of Origin\n> (see [https://developercertificate.org/](https://developercertificate.org/) for more information).\n>\n> \\- [Git Commit Signoff documentation](https://developercertificate.org/)\n\nIf signing your organization's CLA is a strict-requirement for merging this contribution, please feel free to close this PR.\n\n## Sponsorship & Support\n\nThis contribution is sponsored by HUMAN Security Inc. and the new Dan Kaminsky Fellowship, a fellowship created to celebrate Dan's memory and legacy by funding open-source work that makes the world a better (and more secure) place.\n\nThis PR was generated by [Moderne](https://www.moderne.io/), a free-for-open source SaaS offering that uses format-preserving AST transformations to fix bugs, standardize code style, apply best practices, migrate library versions, and fix common security vulnerabilities at scale.\n\n## Tracking\n\nAll PR's generated as part of this fix are tracked here: PDF: how to indicate progress within generation of a large document","body":"**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**\r\n\r\nWe have PDFs that take a long time to generate, many many minutes. Right now \"I am busy, nothing is wrong, please wait longer\" is indistinguishable from \"it's hung, you can wait forever, nothing is going to happen\".\r\n\r\n**Describe the solution you'd like**\r\nIs there a way, inside the PDF document, to indicate progress?\r\n\r\nTo be specific, obviously a \"progress bar\" mechanism would be great between a PDF generator and a PDF client, but assuming that doesn't exist, is there a mechanism to create a single summary page and have that page be sent line by line to the client, saying something like \"Generated blob x47\\nGenerated blob x48\\n\" and so on. Obviously once this summary page is complete, the actual pages will follow.\r\n\r\nBrowser doesn't get bored, end user is encouraged by their document getting longer. Is such a thing possible?\r\n\r\n**Describe alternatives you've considered**\r\n\r\nI would like to avoid having to come up with complex \"come back later when the doc is generated\" scenarios, which have problems of their FileNotFoundException {\r\n        final Document doc = new Document();\r\n        final PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(doc, new FileOutputStream(\"D:\\\\output.pdf\"));\r\n        doc.open();\r\n        addTable(doc);\r\n        doc.close();\r\n    }\r\n    private static void addTable(Document doc) {\r\n        final PdfPTable table = new PdfPTable(1);\r\n        PdfPCell cell = new PdfPCell(new Paragraph(LOREM_IPSUM));\r\n        cell.setPaddingTop(0.0f);\r\n        table.addCell(cell);\r\n        table.addCell(cell);\r\n        doc.add(table);\r\n icu4j from 71.1 to 72.1","body":"Bumps [icu4j](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu) from 71.1 to 72.1.\n<details>\n<summary>Release notes<\/summary>\n<p><em>Sourced from <a href=\"https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/releases\">icu4j's releases<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n<blockquote>\n<h2>ICU 72.1<\/h2>\n<p>We are pleased to announce the release of Unicode¬Æ ICU 72. It updates to <a href=\"https://blog.unicode.org/2022/09/announcing-unicode-standard-version-150.html\">Unicode 15<\/a>, and to <a href=\"https://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-42\">CLDR 42<\/a> locale data with various additions and corrections.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 72 and CLDR 42 are major releases, including a new version of Unicode and major locale data improvements.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 72 adds two technology preview implementations based on draft Unicode specifications:<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Formatting of people\u2019s names in multiple languages (<a href=\"https://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-42#h.nrv6xq99qe7d\">CLDR background<\/a> on why this feature is being added and what it does)<\/li>\n<li>An enhanced version of message formatting<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>This release also updates to the time zone data version 2022e (2022-oct). Note that pre-1970 data for a number of time zones has been removed, as has been the case in the upstream <a href=\"https://www.iana.org/time-zones\">tzdata<\/a> release since 2021b.<\/p>\n<p>For details, please see <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/download/72\">https://icu.unicode.org/download/72<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p><em>Note: The prebuilt WinARM64 binaries below should be considered alpha/experimental.<\/em><\/p>\n<h2>ICU 72rc with CLDR beta3 / tzdata2022d<\/h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/download/72\">https://icu.unicode.org/download/72<\/a><\/p>\n<h2>ICU 72 RC<\/h2>\n<p>We are pleased to announce the release candidate for Unicode¬Æ ICU 72. It updates to <a href=\"https://blog.unicode.org/2022/09/announcing-unicode-standard-version-150.html\">Unicode 15<\/a>, and to <a href=\"https://cldr.unicode.org/index/downloads/cldr-42\">CLDR 42<\/a> locale data with various additions and corrections.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 72 adds technology preview implementations for person name formatting, as well as for a new version of message formatting based on a proposed draft Unicode specification.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 72 and CLDR 42 are major releases, including a new version of Unicode and major locale data improvements.<\/p>\n<p>ICU 72 updates to the time zone data version 2022b (2022-aug) which is effectively the same as 2022c. Note that pre-1970 data for a number of time zones has been removed, as has been the case in the upstream<a href=\"https://www.iana.org/time-zones\"> tzdata<\/a> release since 2021b.<\/p>\n<p>For details, please see <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/download/72\">https://icu.unicode.org/download/72<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Please test this release candidate on your platforms and report bugs and regressions by Tuesday, 2022-oct-18, via the <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/contacts\">icu-support<\/a> mailing list, and/or please <a href=\"https://icu.unicode.org/bugs\">find/submit error reports<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Please do not use this release candidate in production.<\/p>\n<p>The preliminary API reference documents are published on <a href=\"https://unicode-org.github.io/icu-docs/\">unicode-org.github.io/icu-docs/<\/a> \u2013 follow the \u201cDev\u201d links there.<\/p>\n<\/blockquote>\n<\/details>\n<details>\n<summary>Commits<\/summary>\n<ul>\n<li>See full diff in <a href=\"https://github.com/unicode-org/icu/commits\">compare view<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<\/details>\n<br />\n\n\n[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=com.ibm.icu:icu4j&package-manager=maven&previous-version=71.1&new-version=72.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores)\n\nDependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`.\n\n[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start)\n[//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end)\n\n---\n\n<details>\n<summary>Dependabot commands and options<\/summary>\n<br />\n\nYou can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:\n- `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR\n- `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it\n- `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it\n- `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it\n- `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging\n- `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed\n- `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. interface for classes that already implement it","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nI added the AutoCloseable interface on those classes which already implement it. Most of them seem to use it to close files or streams in their implementation, so it is recommended to give them this interface.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: Problem/enhancement mentioned in #812 \r\n\r\n## PDF/A complaint.\r\nValidator shows below error message - [https://www.pdf-online.com/osa/validate.aspx](url)\r\n\r\nFile:   mergeusing_openPDF.pdf\r\nCompliance: pdfa-1a\r\nResult: \r\n     Document does not conform to PDF/A. \r\nDetails:\r\n    Validating file \"mergeusing_openPDF.pdf\" for conformance level pdfa-1a\r\n    The key **MarkInfo** is required but missing.\r\n    The key **StructTreeRoot** is required but missing.\r\n    The document does not conform to the requested standard.\r\n    The document doesn't provide appropriate logical structure information.\r\n    The document does not conform to the PDF/A-1a standard.\r\nDone.  \r\n\r\nAfter debugging we found that, PdfCopy is overriding the getCatalog() method and which is hiding the PdfWriter's implementation of this method which has below lines of code - \r\n catalog.put(PdfName.STRUCTTREEROOT, structureTreeRoot.getReference());\r\n  PdfDictionary mi = new PdfDictionary();\r\n  mi.put(PdfName.MARKED, PdfBoolean.PDFTRUE);\r\n  \r\n  hence the resultant document is missing this metadata which is causing the validation failure.\r\n[ExampleMerge.txt](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/9665614/ExampleMerge.txt)\r\n\r\nHere is related Stack Overflow issue - CIDSet for font subset to ensure PDF/A compliance","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nThe issue is caused by the following [requirement](https://docs.verapdf.org/validation/pdfa-part1/#rule-635-3) of PDF/A specification:\r\n\r\n> **Rule 6.3.5-3** \r\n> For all CIDFont subsets referenced within a conforming file, the font descriptor dictionary shall include a CIDSet stream identifying which CIDs are present in the embedded CIDFont file, as described in PDF Reference Table 5.20.\r\n\r\nThe rule requires a CIDSet stream to be present when a Font subset is used (default behavior for file fonts).\r\n\r\nCurrently OpenPdf contains logic for CIDSet dictionary creation, but it is triggered only when the following condition is satisfied:\r\n```\r\nif (writer.getPDFXConformance() == PdfWriter.PDFA1A || writer.getPDFXConformance() == PdfWriter.PDFA1B) {\r\n    ...\r\n}\r\n```\r\nTo pass this statement, the PDFXConformance variable is required to be provided. However, this is problematic when you do not know in advance what PDF format you deal with. Therefore in the default configuration, an update of a PDF/A document with a font subset breaks its PDF/A compliance.\r\n\r\nTo fix this, I added an additional condition to trigger the CIDSet creation, when a Font Subset is used:\r\n```\r\nif (subset || writer.getPDFXConformance() == PdfWriter.PDFA1A || writer.getPDFXConformance() == PdfWriter.PDFA1B) {\r\n    ...\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nThis change should allow keeping the old behavior for defined PDFXConformance, but also will not break PDF/A compatibility for documents when a format is not known in advance (for example when signing a bulk of PDF documents).\r\n\r\nAdditionally, PDFBox and iText7 seem to created CIDSet in all cases.\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [X] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nCIDSet will be create when a font subset is used.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nAdded unit tests to check text creation options with subset enabled/disabled.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/815/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":815,"updated_at":"2022-09-15T07:39:12Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/815/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1374073196,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/815/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/815.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/815","merged_at":null,"diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/815.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/815"},"state_reason":null,"comments":1,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/815","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/815/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/815","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":3,"+1":2,"rocket":0,"hooray":1,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/815/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"bsanchezb","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/23361149?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/bsanchezb","site_admin":false,"id":23361149,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjIzMzYxMTQ5","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/orgs"},"node_id":"PR_kwDOA8KLhc4_AHyl"},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2022-09-15T07:25:54Z","title":"Add optional metadata/info update in a sequential revision","body":"## Description of the new Feature/Bugfix\r\nWhen changing a document using sequential update (_append=true_), a new /Metadata and /Info dictionaries are being included to the new revision overriding the original values. This change breaks compliance of original PDF/A documents.\r\nBoth of the properties are optional by ISO 32000-1/2, therefore their inclusion or update is not mandatory.\r\n\r\nTherefore, I have added two setters to the PdfStamper, namely _#setUpdateMetadata_ and _#setUpdateDocInfo_ allowing to configure the inclusion of /Metadata and /Info dictionaries to the added sequential revision, respectively.\r\n\r\nThe change does not modify the default behavior of OpenPdf and requires the added parameters to be set to false (false = no update).\r\nMoreover, the new variables are handled only during the new sequential update, and does not impact a new PDF creation or change within the first revision.\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [X] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nThe original behavior is not impacted by the change.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nAdded unit tests for both new setter methods, including PDF non-sequential and sequential update.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/814/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":814,"updated_at":"2022-09-15T07:26:13Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"draft":false,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/814/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1374058775,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/814/timeline","pull_request":{"patch_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/814.patch","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/814","merged_at":null,"diff_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/814.diff","url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pulls/814"},"state_reason":null,"comments":1,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/814","labels":[],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/814/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/814","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":2,"+1":1,"rocket":1,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/814/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"bsanchezb","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/23361149?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/b not displayed correctly in table","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\nI created a little piece of code that draw a table with some data. I only show the \"vertical\" borders of cell in order to display only columns. It renders perfectly.\r\n\r\nHowever, if I add different color for even and odd row (to improve readability), some borders disappear.\r\nThe problem occurs when using Acrobat Reader DC 32bit on Windows 10. The border may reappears depending on the zoom factor applied but then the border looks thiner.\r\nThe problem DOES NOT occur when using the PDF reader of the GNOME desktop of RHEL 8.4.\r\nThe screen resolution is 1920*1080.\r\nI put screenshot and the generated PDF in the attached archive.\r\n\r\nWhat could be the cause of this rendering issue?\r\nDoes Acrobat reader fail or is there something bad in the generated PDF?\r\nIs my code bad?\r\nCould it be linked rounding errors? I see the OpenPDF API is using float instead of double.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nUse the reproducer code. The constant \"ENABLE_ROW_COLORING\" could be use to enable and disable the row colouring.\r\n\r\n`package com.acme;`\r\n\r\n`import java.awt.Color;`\r\n`import java.io.FileOutputStream;`\r\n`import java.util.Date;`\r\n\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Cell;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Chunk;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Document;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Font;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.FontFactory;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.PageSize;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Paragraph;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Rectangle;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.Table;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;`\r\n`import com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;`\r\n\r\n`public class IssueReproducer {`\r\n`    private static final boolean ENABLE_ROW_COLORING = true;`\r\n`    private static final int[] COLUMN_WIDTH = {20, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 30};`\r\n`    private static final String[] HEADERS = new String[] {\"Date & Time\", \"Severity\", \"Class\", \"Package\", \"Name\", \"User\", \"Description\"};`\r\n\r\n`    private static final String[][] DATA = new String[][] {`\r\n`        {\"2022-08-09T09:31:58.888+02:00\", \"INFO\"  , \"Security\", \"Quantum Trashing Can 1.2.734\"               , \"login.success\"             , \"alice\", \"user alice log in succesfuly.\"},`\r\n`        {\"Tue Aug 09 09:24:56 CEST 2022\", \"Severe\", \"Security\", \"Quantum Trashing Can Administration 1.2.734\", \"auth.server.disabled.failure\", \"john\" , \" Failed to disable RADIUS one-time password authentication server 4leaves. server group 4leaves disabled by user alice.\"},`\r\n`        {\"2022-08-09T09:32:45.767+02:00\", \"INFO\"  , \"Security\", \"Quantum Trashing Can Administration 1.2.734\", \"users.create.success\"        , \"bob\"  , \"User 4f has been created successfully\"},`\r\n`    };`\r\n\r\n`    private static final float BORDER_WIDTH = 0.75F;`\r\n`    private static final Color BLACK = new Color(0, 0, 0);`\r\n`    private static final Color LIGHT_GREY = new Color(240, 240, 240);`\r\n`    private static final Rectangle PAGE_FORMAT = PageSize.A4.rotate();`\r\n`    private static final float FONT_SIZE = 8F;`\r\n`    private static final Font FONT_HEADER = FontFactory.getFont(BaseFont.COURIER_BOLD, FONT_SIZE);`\r\n`    private static final Font FONT_DATA = FontFactory.getFont(BaseFont.COURIER, FONT_SIZE);`\r\n`    private static final float MARGIN = 18F;`\r\n`    private static final String OUTPUTFILE = \"bad_border.pdf\";`\r\n\r\n`    private static Cell getNewCell(final int pIndexX, final int pIndexY) {`\r\n`        Cell cell = new Cell();`\r\n\r\n`        if (ENABLE_ROW_COLORING) {`\r\n`            // Set grey background on 'odd' row`\r\n`            if ( (pIndexY & 1) == 1 ) {`\r\n`                // grey`\r\n`                cell.setBackgroundColor(LIGHT_GREY);`\r\n`            } else {`\r\n`                // white`\r\n`            }`\r\n`        }`\r\n\r\n`        // Set only vertical border`\r\n`        cell.setBorderColor(BLACK);`\r\n`        cell.setBorderWidth(0);`\r\n`        cell.setBorderWidthRight(BORDER_WIDTH);`\r\n\r\n`        // Ensure left border is set only on the first column`\r\n`        if (pIndexX == 0) {`\r\n`            cell.setBorderWidthLeft(BORDER_WIDTH);`\r\n`        } else {`\r\n`            cell.setBorderWidthLeft(0);`\r\n`        }`\r\n\r\n`        return cell;`\r\n`    }`\r\n\r\n`    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {`\r\n`        Document document = new Document(PAGE_FORMAT, MARGIN, MARGIN, MARGIN, MARGIN);`\r\n`        PdfWriter.getInstance(document, new FileOutputStream(OUTPUTFILE));`\r\n`        document.open();`\r\n\r\n`        final String now = (new Date()).toString();`\r\n`        document.add(new Paragraph(now));`\r\n\r\n`        Table table = new Table(HEADERS.length);`\r\n`        table.setBorderWidth(0);`\r\n`        table.setPadding(5);`\r\n`        table.setSpacing(0);`\r\n`        table.setCellsFitPage(true);`\r\n`        table.setWidth(100);`\r\n`        table.setWidths(COLUMN_WIDTH);`\r\n\r\n`        // Write titles`\r\n`        int indexX = 0;`\r\n`        for (String header : HEADERS) {`\r\n`            Chunk chunk = new Chunk(header, FONT_HEADER);`\r\n\r\n`            Cell cell = getNewCell(indexX, 0);`\r\n`            cell.setHeader(true);`\r\n\r\n`            cell.add(chunk);`\r\n\r\n`            table.addCell(cell);`\r\n`            indexX++;`\r\n`        }`\r\n`        table.endHeaders();`\r\n\r\n`        // Write data`\r\n`        int indexY = 0;`\r\n`        for (String[] row : DATA) {`\r\n`            indexX = 0;`\r\n`            for (String value : row) {`\r\n`                Chunk chunk = new Chunk(value, FONT_DATA);`\r\n\r\n`                Cell cell = getNewCell(indexX, indexY);`\r\n`                cell.setHeader(false);`\r\n\r\n`                cell.add(chunk);`\r\n\r\n`                table.addCell(cell);`\r\n`                indexX++;`\r\n`            }`\r\n`            indexY++;`\r\n`        }`\r\n\r\n`        document.add(table);`\r\n\r\n`        document.close();`\r\n`    }`\r\n\r\n`}`\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nI in indentation and tab positions","body":"The widt() method of a TAB PdfChunk must return 0.0f to avoid it from advancing the position away from the given tab-position. It used to move to the right the width of the placeholder character in the chunk.\r\n\r\nWhen using a negative value for setFirstLineIndent, the original width of the PdfLine must be adjusted. position is not interpreted correctly","body":"When setting TAB positions for a Paragraph, the resulting text is positioned one character width too far to the right in respect to the given position. This becomes very obvious and annoying when used in combination with setIndentationLeft as the resulting positions are different. \r\n\r\nThe code used looks like this.\r\n                  float left = currentParagraph.getIndentationLeft();\r\n                  float first = currentParagraph.getFirstLineIndent();\r\n                  Chunk newTab = new Chunk(new VerticalPositionMark(), pos.floatValue() - (left + first));\r\n                  currentParagraph.add(newTab);\r\n\r\nThe cause of this error can be found in the PdfChunk.width() method. It is my suggestion to modify this method to look like this.\r\n\r\n    float width() {\r\n        // Add this code\r\n        if (isAttribute(Chunk.TAB))\r\n            return 0.0f;\r\n\r\n        if (isAttribute(Chunk.CHAR_SPACING)) {\r\n            Float cs = (Float) getAttribute(Chunk.CHAR_SPACING);\r\n            return font.width(value) + value.length() * cs;\r\n        }\r\n        return font.width(value);\r\n    }\r\n\r\nI am aware that user probably have adjusted to this error and existing implementations might change SVG for beautifying signatures","body":"This comes from the JSignPdf program. I was told from the developers that the following is an OpenPdf issue.\r\n\r\nIn order to make the signature on a pdf file better looking a good way is to use  the TeX system. A wrote a trivial script that can create the visual part of the signature using XeLaTeX (so any font can be used, any color, and so many other things can be tweaked like lineskip). This is done every time so that TeX gets the proper timestamp to the image it creates.\r\nThe pdf output of xetex can be converted to png and included as background to the visual signature with empty text. Finally the script calls the JSignPdf on the command line to complete the task.\r\n\r\nThis produces really beautiful signatures but there is a problem with the image format. png is not scalable and JSignPdf does not know how to use svg instead of png.\r\n\r\nSVG can be embedded in pdf (xetex does it for example). So my question is\r\nif it would be easy to support a scalable format such as svg. Or even pdf which might be simpler (I do not know). I guess SVG would be better as it supports Instead if elimination of shared streams is needed in some case the public method can be called explicitly.\r\n\r\nRelated Issue: #763\r\n\r\n## Unit-Tests for the new Feature/Bugfix\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to reproduce the bug\r\n- [ ] Unit-Tests added to the added feature\r\n\r\n## Compatibilities Issues\r\nIs anything broken because of the new code? Any changes in method signatures?\r\nMethod signatures are the same but if elimination of shared streams are required for some use case then this method needs to be called explicitly from now.\r\n\r\n## Testing details\r\nAny other details about how to test the new feature or bugfix?\r\nTested with PDF documents having this issue. documents with shared objects/streams gets the modified page blank after signing","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\nFor certain documents putting a visible signature in a page which has a /Contents with an array where one or more of the objects within it has the same number as an object in an other page causes the page with the visible signature to be blank. (Additionally if signed more then once, all but the last signature will show up as invalid in Acrobat.)\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nCode to reproduce the issue\r\n1. Sample Code\r\n```\r\ntry (PdfReader reader = new PdfReader(\"pdflib-duplicated-out.pdf\");\r\n        FileInputStream ksIn = new FileInputStream(\"dss10_keystore.p12\")) {\r\n\r\n    Security.addProvider(new BouncyCastleProvider());\r\n    KeyStore ks = KeyStore.getInstance(\"pkcs12\", \"BC\");\r\n    ks.load(ksIn, \"foo123\".toCharArray());\r\n    PrivateKey key = (PrivateKey) ks.getKey(\"signer00003\", null);\r\n    Certificate[] chain = ks.getCertificateChain(\"signer00003\");\r\n\r\n    FileOutputStream fout = new FileOutputStream(new File(\"target\", \"pdflib-duplicated-out-signed1.pdf\"));\r\n    PdfStamper stp = PdfStamper.createSignature(reader, fout, '\\0', new File(\"/tmp\"), true);\r\n    PdfSignatureAppearance sap = stp.getSignatureAppearance();\r\n    sap.setCrypto(key, chain, null, PdfSignatureAppearance.WINCER_SIGNED);\r\n\r\n    // Make a modification so the page will be rewritten as it does not happen for this file otherwise for unclear resons\r\n    stp.getUnderContent(2).rectangle(1, 1, 100, 100);\r\n\r\n    sap.setVisibleSignature(new Rectangle(100, 100, 200, 200), 2, null);\r\n    stp.close();\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nFull project is available here: https://github.com/netmackan/openpdf-eliminatestreams-issue\r\n\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nAdding a digital signature to a PDF should not make the page with the visible signature blank. Also it should be possible to sign the same PDF multiple times without the verifier to complain about the previous revisions to have been modified.\r\n\r\n**Screenshots**\r\nThis screenshot shows the PDF after being signed. Normally all three pages should look similar but now page 2 is blank:\r\n![Three pages where the second is blank](https://github.com/netmackan/openpdf-eliminatestreams-issue/raw/main/pdflib-duplicated-out-signed1.png)\r\n\r\n**System (please complete the following information):**\r\n - OS: Linux. Verifying on Windows.\r\n - Used Font: No special\r\n\r\n**Additional context**\r\nFrom debugging it can be seen that in the and of reading the PDF in the PdfReader class there is a method call _eliminateSharedStreams()_ that seems to be causing this. Removing that call and the PDF seems to look correct and any further digital signatures verifies correctly in Acrobat.\r\n\r\nPDF tools like iText RUPS shows a null entry in the array after signing and pdfcpu complains about \"nil\" objects. However, looking closer with the debugger shows that the shared references in the array are being replaced with new object numbers, however those objects are not added to the new PDF.\r\n\r\nFork with the eliminateSharedStreams() call commented out: https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/compare/master...netmackan:no-eliminate-shared-streams-2\r\n\r\nI have 4 different files with this issue created/modified using either QuarkExpress or pdf-lib.js. Unfortunately, those can not be shared however. I have managed to reproduce the issue with a public file which is available here (as part of the sample code): However, the page size I set doesn't appear to take effect until the next page.  This worked differently in the older version of iText we ported this from.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n```\r\n    /**\r\n     * Convert TIFF to PDF.\r\n     * Used for processing incoming Fax data.\r\n     */\r\n    public byte[] convertTIFFToPDF(byte[] originalBytes) throws Throwable {\r\n\r\n        // Make sure input is non-null\r\n        originalBytes = (originalBytes == null) ? new byte[0] : originalBytes;\r\n\r\n        Document document = new Document();\r\n        ByteArrayOutputStream outfile = new ByteArrayOutputStream();\r\n        ByteArrayInputStream bais = null;\r\n\r\n        PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, outfile);\r\n        writer.setStrictImageSequence(true);\r\n        document.open();\r\n\r\n        bais = new ByteArrayInputStream(originalBytes);\r\n\r\n        ImageInputStream iis = ImageIO.createImageInputStream(bais);\r\n\r\n        if (iis == null) {\r\n            throw new IllegalStateException(\"Cannot create ImageInputStream for bytes\");\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        ImageReader reader = getTIFFImageReader();\r\n        reader.setInput(iis);\r\n        int pages = reader.getNumImages(true);\r\n        for (int imageIndex = 0; imageIndex < pages; imageIndex++) {\r\n            BufferedImage bufferedImage = reader.read(imageIndex);\r\n            Image image = Image.getInstance(bufferedImage, null, false);\r\n            if (image.getDpiX() > 0 && image.getDpiY() > 0) {\r\n                image.scalePercent(7200f / image.getDpiX(), 7200f / image.getDpiY());\r\n            }\r\n\r\n            document.setPageSize(new Rectangle(image.getScaledWidth(), image.getScaledHeight()));\r\n\r\n            image.setAlignment(Image.MIDDLE);\r\n\r\n            /* ---> PROBLEM HERE: THIS IMAGE APPEARS IN PDF AS DEFAULT PAGE SIZE (A4)\r\n             * FOR FIRST PAGE INSTEAD OF PAGE SIZE WE JUST SET.  IN THIS LOOP, PAGE SIZE SEEMS\r\n             * TO LAG FROM LAST PAGE SIZE SET.\r\n             */\r\n            /* This worked in an older version of iText, but not in current version of OpenPDF */\r\n            document.add(image);\r\n\r\n            document.newPage();\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    private static ImageReader getTIFFImageReader() {\r\n\r\n        Iterator<ImageReader> imageReaders = ImageIO.getImageReadersByFormatName(\"TIFF\");\r\n\r\n        if (!imageReaders.hasNext()) {\r\n            throw new UnsupportedOperationException(\"No TIFF Reader found\");\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        return imageReaders.next();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n```\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nPage size applies to current page, not next page.\r\n\r\n**Screenshots**\r\n\r\n**System (please complete Default Appearance is created for an empty signature field?","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\nAs initially reported in [DSS-2691](https://ec.europa.eu/digital-building-blocks/tracker/browse/DSS-2691), OpenPdf adds _/DA_ and _/DR_ dictionaries in an empty signature field creation, when using the method [PdfStamper.addSignature(...)](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/1.3.26/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/PdfStamper.java#L479).\r\nThis is caused by the line [PdfStamper.java#L483](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/1.3.26/openpdf/src/main/java/com/lowagie/text/pdf/PdfStamper.java#L483), reason for which execution is not clear. The line causing the issue is copied below:\r\n```\r\nacroForm.drawSignatureAppearences(signature, llx, lly, urx, ury);\r\n```\r\n\r\nThe problem is, as the result, an empty signature field is being created with a pre-configured font settings, which are not necessary will be used after the signature creation. This may cause an incompliance to a PDF/A specification for a produced document.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n```\r\n// get Stamper\r\n\r\nPdfStamper stp = ....\r\nstp.addSignature(...);\r\nstp.close();\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nWe would like to know the reason why the Default Appearance is being added to an AcroForm for an empty signature field, not containing any visual data? As defined in ISO 32000-1, the fields _/DA_ and _/DR_ are optional for the AcroForm dictionary, therefore there is no strong requirement for its addition.\r\nMoreover, removing of the line does not seem to be causing any issues with existing unit tests available in OpenPDF project, nor in our testing.\r\nThus, we would appreciate any comments regarding this topic. If it is not necessary, to my opinion, it would be advisable to remove signature appearance drawing from _PdfStamper.addSignature(...)_ and _PdfAcroForm.addSignature(...)_ methods as a default behavior.\r\n\r\n**System (please complete the following information):**\r\nOpenPdf 1.3.26\r\n\r\n**Additional context**\r\nTo demonstrate the difference between two documents created with and without executing the #drawSignatureAppearences method, I attach two PDF documents to this ticket.\r\n\r\n[new-pdf-with-da.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/8186840/new-pdf-with-da.pdf) (with #drawSignatureAppearences)\r\n[new-pdf-without-da.pdf](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/8186841/new-pdf-without-da.pdf) (without #drawSignatureAppearences)\r\n\r\n\r\nBest regards,\r\nAleksandr.\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":680,"updated_at":"2022-03-10T13:21:45Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":1159756003,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680/timeline","state_reason":null,"comments":4,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/680/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"bsanchezb","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/23361149?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/bsanchezb/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/bsanchezb","site_admin":false,"id":23 Issue.\r\nBasically, if we parse a HTML String through `HTMLWorker.parseToList`, we get a list of PDF elements that we can add to our document. The problem is that when we parse a nested HTML list, the nesting is not done properly in the PDF.\r\n\r\nThe HTML List looks like this:\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11201041/138403286-1491f694-2203-4b21-859e-06607daada2a.png)\r\n\r\n\r\nThe PDF list looks like this:\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11201041/138403331-657f281e-f036-4c4e-8504-262dbccbe177.png)\r\n\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\n```\r\nDocument doc = new  \"<ul>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t<li>Level 1<\/li>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t<li> Level 2 items:\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t\\t<ul>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t\\t\\t<li>Level 2<\/li>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t\\t\\t<li>Level 2<\/li>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t\\t<\/ul>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t<\/li>\\n\" +\r\n        \"\\t<li>Level 1<\/li>\\n\" +\r\n        \"<\/ul>\";\r\nfinal StringReader reader = new StringReader(htmlText);\r\nfinal StyleSheet styleSheet = new StyleSheet();\r\nfinal Map<String, Object> interfaceProps = new HashMap<>();\r\n\r\nfinal java.util.List<Element> elements = HTMLWorker.parseToList(reader, styleSheet, interfaceProps);\r\n\r\nelements.forEach(doc::add);\r\n\r\ndoc.close();\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nThe PDF list should be also nested as seen in fonts of form fields not working correctly","body":"**Management summary:**\r\n\r\nWhen setting a font for a form field openPDF adds the `DA` to the widget (annotation) and not to the value (form field). This is not correct according to the spec.\r\n\r\n**Details:**\r\nThere seems to be problem with the current implementation when changing or adding fonts for form fields.\r\nOriginal PDF:\r\n```\r\n108 0 obj\r\n<<\/T(names)/Kids[213 0 R 63 0 R 146 0 R]/V() /DA(/Arial 8 Tf 0 g)/FT/Tx>>\r\nendobj\r\n213 0 obj\r\n<<\/P 57 0 R/Subtype/Widget/F 4/Type/Annot/MK<<\/BG[1.0 1.0 1.0]>>/Parent 108 0 R/Rect[48.6151 663.511 278.523 674.84]/AP<<\/N 21 0 R>>>>\r\nendobj\r\n[...]\r\n```\r\n\r\nSo now I change the font from Arial to TimesNewRoman \r\n```\r\nBaseFont font = BaseFont.createFont(BaseFont.TIMES_ROMAN, encoding, BaseFont.EMBEDDED);\r\nstamper.getAcroFields().setFieldProperty(\"names\", \"textfont\", font), null);\r\n```\r\n\r\nand the result is like this:\r\n\r\n```\r\n127 0 obj\r\n<<\/TU(AlternateFieldName)/T(names)/Kids[109 0 R 82 0 R 110 0 R]/V(Else Something)/DA(/Arial 8 Tf 0 g)/FT/Tx/Ff 29360130>>\r\nendobj\r\n109 0 obj\r\n<<\/BS<<\/S/I/W 1>>/P 64 0 R/Subtype/Widget/F 4/Type/Annot/DA(/TiRo 11 Tf 1 1 1 rg )/MK<<\/BC[1 0 0]/R 0/BG[0.10196 0.2 0.30196]>>/Parent 127 0 R/Rect[45 135 150 155]/AP<<\/N 17 0 R>>>>\r\nendobj\r\n```\r\nThe result is not correct I would say:\r\n1. The DA of the parent stays the same\r\n2. The DA is added to the child thus the widget \r\n\r\nBut according to the PDF spec it belongs to the formfield (thus `values` in openPDF words).\r\nAdding the DA to the widget is the problem.  When looking at the implementation the error seems to be (AcroFields.java lines 1071/1072)\r\n\r\n```\r\n public boolean setFieldProperty(String field, String name, Object value, int inst[]) {\r\n  ...\r\n  item.getWidget(k).put(PdfName.DA, s);\r\n  markUsed(item.getWidget(k));\r\n```\r\nWhen changing it to:\r\n```\r\n item.getValue(k).put(PdfName.DA, s);\r\n markUsed(item.getValue(k));\r\n```\r\nsolved it for me. Now the parent element contains the correct DA:\r\n\r\n```\r\n127 0 obj\r\n<<\/T(names)/Kids[109 0 R 82 0 R 110 0 R]/V(Else Something)/DA(/TiRo 11 Tf 1 1 1 rg )/FT/Tx/Ff 29360130>>\r\nendobj\r\n```\r\n\r\n**Summary:** When updating the font of a form field the DA key is added to the wrong dictionary. \r\n                      Any thoughts/views/rejections on this? If not I would create a merge request for this.","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":555,"updated_at":"2021-06-03T12:45:53Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":909700071,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555/timeline","state_reason":null,"comments":0,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":0,"+1":0,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/555/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"Lonzak","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1830174?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/Lonzak","site_admin":false,"id":1830174,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjE4MzAxNzQ=", leads to pixelated rendered text","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\n\r\nIf the [svg](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/ZwoGYsiZYRWLUsSKDizUhWCt) file contains text `shape-rendering=\"geometricPrecision\"` the text in the rendered [pdf file](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/yrUFvcBZTYoQsYrTdjpLYDlw) is pixelated. If remove `shape-rendering=\"geometricPrecision\"` from the [svg file](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/ZwoGYsiZYRWLUsSKDizUhWCt) the text in the [pdf](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/aTACuyfhdAlOQmtiqcKgkWEW) is sharp.\r\n\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nCode to reproduce the issue\r\n\r\n```java\r\n  public void renderOpenPdf(SVGDocument document, float dpi, Color backgroundColor, OutputStream outputStream) {\r\n    Document pdfDoc = new Document();\r\n    pdfDoc.open();\r\n    Dimension dim = SVGUtil.readDimension(document.getDocumentElement());\r\n    Dimension mmDimension = dim.scaled(25.4f / dpi);\r\n    Rectangle pageSize = new Rectangle(mmDimension.getWidth() / 25.4f * 72, mmDimension.getHeight() / 25.4f * 72);\r\n    if (backgroundColor != null) {\r\n      pageSize.setBackgroundColor(backgroundColor);\r\n    }\r\n    pdfDoc.setPageSize(pageSize);\r\n\r\n    PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(pdfDoc, outputStream);\r\n    pdfDoc.open();\r\n\r\n    PdfContentByte cb = writer.getDirectContent();\r\n    Graphics2D g2d = cb.createGraphics(pageSize.getWidth(), pageSize.getHeight());\r\n\r\n    renderPdf(pdfDoc, g2d, document, pageSize);\r\n\r\n    g2d.dispose();\r\n    pdfDoc.close();\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  public void renderPdf(Document pdfDoc, Graphics2D g2, SVGDocument svgDoc, Rectangle pageSize) {\r\n    pdfDoc.setPageSize(pageSize);\r\n\r\n    TranscoderInput ti = new TranscoderInput(svgDoc);\r\n    PrintTranscoder transcoder = new PrintTranscoder();\r\n    transcoder.transcode(ti, null);\r\n\r\n    PageFormat page = new PageFormat();\r\n    Paper paper = new Paper();\r\n    paper.setSize(pageSize.getWidth(), pageSize.getHeight());\r\n    paper.setImageableArea(0, 0, pageSize.getWidth(), pageSize.getHeight());\r\n    page.setPaper(paper);\r\n    transcoder.print(g2, page, 0);\r\n  }\r\n```\r\n\r\n1. Remove `shape-rendering=\"geometricPrecision\"` from the [svg file](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/WLxZKCUOPlYHKUxYzrrVmgjR)\r\n2. Render to pdf\r\n\r\n**Expected behavior**\r\nA sharp rendered text, if `shape-rendering=\"geometricPrecision\"` is **\"on\"**.\r\n\r\n**Screenshots**\r\n\r\n`shape-rendering=\"geometricPrecision\"` **\"on\"**:\r\n![text_test_shape-rendering_geometricPrecision_on](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/125954/109535040-57c68380-7abc-11eb-9445-cccd340d229a.png)\r\n\r\n`shape-rendering=\"geometricPrecision\"` **\"off\"**:\r\n![text_test_shape-rendering_geometricPrecision_off](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/125954/109534767-f999a080-7abb-11eb-8f61-0853f43ed65e.png)\r\n\r\n**System (please complete the following information):**\r\n - OS: Arch Linux / EndeavourOS\r\n - Used Font: Have a look in the [attached zip file](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/6063394/text_test_shape-rendering_geometricPrecision.zip), which contains the [svg file.](https://matrix-client.matrix.org/_matrix/media/r0/download/matrix.org/ZwoGYsiZYRWLUsSKDizUhWCt)\r\n\r\n*SVG file and resulting PDF files*\r\n[text_test_shape-rendering_geometricPrecision.zip](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/files/6063394/text_test_shape-rendering_geometricPrecision.zip)\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497/labels{/name}","author_association":"NONE","number":497,"updated_at":"2021-05-21T14:44:51Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":819117139,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497/timeline","state_reason":null,"comments":7,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":1,"+1":1,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/497/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"BuZZ-dEE","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/125954?v=4","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/events{/privacy}","html_url":"https://github.com/BuZZ-dEE","site_admin":false,"id":125954,"gravatar_id":"","node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEyNTk1NA==","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/BuZZ-dEE/orgs"},"node_id":"MDU6SXNzdWU4MTkxMTcxMzk="},{"assignees":[],"created_at":"2021-02-27T01:00:25Z","title":"OpenPDF Not Using JVM Supplied Fonts","body":"**Describe the bug**\r\nWe recently switched our JDK to OpenJDK and were looking to substitute the fonts with Liberation as it is a quick package install on Linux. The reporting tool we use is JasperReports which calls in to OpenPDF to find its fonts but it wasn't finding them no matter what. After a bit of digging through the sources, it seems like the list of available fonts has been hard coded using a completely unrelated framework to what the JVM is doing. I may be misunderstanding this greatly due to my limited knowledge in this area, but is there a reason OpenPDF doesn't use java.awt for the font lookup? The JVM already does all the leg work for loading in fonts via the OS and the corresponding fontconfig if they exist.\r\n\r\nI know this issue should be fairly easily addressed by providing a JAR for JasperReports to handle the font extensions, however we do have a large number of releases and servers that make this more of an issue.\r\n\r\n**To Reproduce**\r\nThis is a basic test to see what is available to our JVM runtime (These are groovy scripts I am testing with):\r\n```\r\nimport java.awt.*;\r\nfinal Font[] fonts = GraphicsEnvironment.getLocalGraphicsEnvironment().getAllFonts();\r\nSystem.out.println(\"\");\r\nfor (int i = 0; i < fonts.length; i++) {\r\n  System.out.println(fonts[i].getFontName() + \" : \" + fonts[i].getFamily() + \" : \" + fonts[i].getName());\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nAnd some logic to test the matcher:\r\n```\r\nimport java.awt.*;\r\n\r\nmatchFont(\"Liberation Sans\", Font.PLAIN);\r\nmatchFont(\"Liberation Serif\", Font.PLAIN);\r\nmatchFont(\"Liberation Mono\", Font.PLAIN);\r\nmatchFont(\"DejaVu Sans\", Font.PLAIN);\r\nmatchFont(\"DejaVu Serif\", Font.PLAIN);\r\nmatchFont(\"DejaVu Sans Mono\", Font.PLAIN);\r\nmatchFont(\"Helvetica\", Font.PLAIN);\r\n\r\nvoid matchFont(String fontName, int fontType) {\r\n  Font font = new Font(fontName, fontType, 10);\r\n  System.out.println(\"testFontName=\" + fontName + \": matchFamily=\" + font.getFamily()+\", matchName=\" + font.getFontName());\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nOutput:\r\n```\r\ntestFontName=Liberation Sans: matchFamily=Liberation Sans, matchName=Liberation Sans\r\ntestFontName=Liberation Serif: matchFamily=Liberation Serif, matchName=Liberation Serif\r\ntestFontName=Liberation Mono: matchFamily=Liberation Mono, matchName=Liberation Mono\r\ntestFontName=DejaVu Sans: matchFamily=DejaVu Sans, matchName=DejaVu Sans\r\ntestFontName=DejaVu Serif: matchFamily=Dialog, matchName=Dialog.plain\r\ntestFontName=DejaVu Sans Mono: matchFamily=Dialog, matchName=Dialog.plain\r\ntestFontName=Helvetica: matchFamily=SansSerif, matchName=SansSerif.plain\r\n```\r\n\r\nA couple of the fonts aren't available or configured so it just matches to a generic one.\r\n\r\nHere is my attempt as OpenPDF matching:\r\n```\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.*;\r\n\r\nmatchFont(\"Liberation Sans\");\r\nmatchFont(\"Liberation Serif\");\r\nmatchFont(\"Liberation Mono\");\r\nmatchFont(\"DejaVu Sans\");\r\nmatchFont(\"DejaVu Serif\");\r\nmatchFont(\"DejaVu Sans Mono\");\r\nmatchFont(\"Helvetica\");\r\nmatchFont(\"Courier\");\r\n\r\nvoid matchFont(String fontName) {\r\n  Font font = FontFactory.getFont(fontName, 10);\r\n  System.out.println(\"testFontName=\" + fontName + \", matchFamilyName=\" + font.getFamilyname() + \", baseFont=\" + (font.getBaseFont() ? font.getFamilyname() : null));\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\nOutput:\r\n```\r\ntestFontName=Liberation Sans, matchFamilyName=unknown, baseFont=null\r\ntestFontName=Liberation Serif, matchFamilyName=unknown, baseFont=null\r\ntestFontName=Liberation Mono, matchFamilyName=unknown, baseFont=null\r\ntestFontName=DejaVu Sans, matchFamilyName=unknown, baseFont=null\r\ntestFontName=DejaVu Serif, matchFamilyName=unknown, baseFont=null\r\ntestFontName=DejaVu Sans Mono, matchFamilyName=unknown, baseFont=null\r\ntestFontName=Helvetica, matchFamilyName=Helvetica, baseFont=Helvetica\r\ntestFontName=Courier, matchFamilyName=Courier, baseFont=Courier\r\n```\r\n\r\nBased on the FontFactoryImp, the list of fonts appears to be hard coded if you are not manually registering them as a developer.\r\n\r\nThis is likely not a bug and more of a design issue which would be more of a feature request, but I want to verify if I am missing anything as a part of this process of adding more fonts.\r\n\r\nAny assistance or input on this would be greatly
