in a table split due a page break, is rendered wrong","body":"## Describe the bug\r\nGiven I have a table, where radio buttons of the same radio-group are put in different rows.\r\n\r\nWhen this table is split, because of a page break, having the row with radio button 1 still on page 1, and the row with radio button 2 on page 2,\r\n\r\nthen the radio button 2 will be drawn correctly on page 2, but radio button 1 will not be drawn on page 1, but on page 2, and in the position, as if it was drawn on page 1. (See generated PDF from code bellow)\r\n\r\n## To Reproduce\r\nThis can be reproduced with this code:\r\n\r\n```java\r\nmport com.lowagie.text.Chunk;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Document;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.ExceptionConverter;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.PageSize;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Paragraph;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.Rectangle;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.GrayColor;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfContentByte;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfFormField;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPCell;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPCellEvent;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfPTable;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.PdfWriter;\r\nimport com.lowagie.text.pdf.RadioCheckField;\r\nimport java.io.FileNotFoundException;\r\nimport java.io.FileOutputStream;\r\nimport java.io.IOException;\r\nimport java.util.Arrays;\r\n\r\npublic class RadioButtonPageBreak {\r\n\r\n    public static void main(String... args) throws FileNotFoundException, DocumentException {\r\n        Document document = new Document(PageSize.A4);\r\n        FileOutputStream outputStream = new FileOutputStream(\"RadioButtonPageBreak.pdf\");\r\n        PdfWriter writer = PdfWriter.getInstance(document, outputStream);\r\n\r\n        document.open();\r\n        almostFillThePage(document);\r\n        addTableWithRadioButtons(document, writer);\r\n        document.close();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    private static void almostFillThePage(Document document) throws DocumentException {\r\n        document.add(new Paragraph(\r\n                \"This example shows: A table with a radio group. Each radio button is in a different row. If the\"\r\n                        + \" table is split due a page break, then the radio button on page 1will be drawn in page 2,\"\r\n                        + \" but in the corresponding page position, as if it was drawn in page 1.\"));\r\n        for (int i = 0; i < 36; i++) {\r\n            document.add(Chunk.NEWLINE);\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    private static void addTableWithRadioButtons(Document document, PdfWriter writer) throws DocumentException {\r\n        PdfPTable table = new PdfPTable(3);\r\n        // Add some rows before the radio buttons, so we get the break in the desired position\r\n        addRow(table, \"Column 1\", \"Column 2\", \"Column 3\");\r\n        addRow(table, \"Radio buttons\", \"coming\", \"soon\");\r\n\r\n        // Radio button rows\r\n        PdfFormField radioGroup = PdfFormField.createRadioButton(writer, true);\r\n        radioGroup.setFieldName(\"radio\");\r\n        String[] values = {\"Selection One\", \"Selection Two\"};\r\n        for (String value : values) {\r\n            PdfPCell radioCell = new PdfPCell();\r\n            radioCell.setCellEvent(new MyCellEvent(radioGroup, value, writer));\r\n            table.addCell(radioCell);\r\n            table.addCell(value);\r\n            table.completeRow();\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // Add table and radioGroup\r\n        document.add(table);\r\n        writer.addAnnotation(radioGroup); // Adding radioGroup after adding the table\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    private static void addRow(PdfPTable table, String... cells) {\r\n        Arrays.stream(cells).forEach(table::addCell);\r\n        table.completeRow();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    private static class MyCellEvent implements PdfPCellEvent {\r\n\r\n        private final PdfFormField radioGroup;\r\n        private final String value;\r\n        private final PdfWriter writer;\r\n\r\n        public MyCellEvent(PdfFormField radioGroup, String value, PdfWriter writer) {\r\n            this.radioGroup = radioGroup;\r\n            this.value = value;\r\n            this.writer = writer;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        @Override\r\n        public void cellLayout(PdfPCell cell, Rectangle position, PdfContentByte[] canvases) {\r\n            RadioCheckField radio = new RadioCheckField(writer, position, null, value);\r\n            radio.setBorderColor(GrayColor.GRAYBLACK);\r\n            radio.setCheckType(RadioCheckField.TYPE_CIRCLE);\r\n            try {\r\n                radioGroup.addKid(radio.getRadioField());\r\n            } catch (final IOException | DocumentException e) {\r\n                throw new ExceptionConverter(e);\r\n            }\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n}\r\n```\r\n\r\n\r\n## Expected behavior\r\nRadio button 1 should be rendered on page 1 in the last row of the table.\r\n\r\n","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/489/labels{/name}","author_association":"MEMBER","number":489,"updated_at":"2021-04-21T22:08:49Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/489/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":806245559,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/489/timeline","state_reason":null,"comments":2,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/489","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="},{"default":true,"color":"128A0C","name":"help still vulnerable to Signature wraping attack","body":"By accident I stumbled over the [fix ](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/158) for the signature wrapping attack (you might remember in 2019 there were some PDF [vulnerabilities](https://www.pdf-insecurity.org/signature/signature.html#attack-3-signature-wrapping-swa) published)\r\nThere also has been a fix for openPDF for one of the attacks. However the fix doesn't fix it correctly (imho). It becomes obvious by looking at the junit test which was added with the fix:\r\n\r\n```\r\n            //this was fixed, previously true\r\n            Assertions.assertFalse(fields.signatureCoversWholeDocument(signName));\r\n            PdfPKCS7 pdfPkcs7 = fields.verifySignature(signName, \"BC\");\r\n            //this is wrong - openPDF should not report that the signature is valid\r\n            Assertions.assertTrue(pdfPkcs7.verify());\r\n```\r\nIf you open the `siwa.pdf` in adobe reader it correctly reports a broken/invalid signature and so should openPDF.\r\nThe fix basically now detects that the signature doesn't cover the full document - but this does apply to all (perfectly correct) PDFs which have more than 1 signature. Because if you add a 2nd (or 3rd, 4th ...) all the previous signatures do not cover the whole document anymore. Only the last one potentially does. Now one could conclude that if there is only one signature (or the last one) and it doesn't cover the whole document, something is not right. However there are allowed changes to any signed document and if those changes have been applied in append mode then also the last (or only) signature does not cover the whole document.\r\n\r\nThus `pdfPkcs7.verify()` **must** return false to clearly state that something is not right with this document.\r\n\r\nWhat does the openPDF community think?","labels_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487/labels{/name}","author_association":"CONTRIBUTOR","number":487,"updated_at":"2022-02-18T05:45:36Z","performed_via_github_app":null,"comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487/comments","active_lock_reason":null,"repository_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF","id":801747033,"state":"open","locked":false,"timeline_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487/timeline","state_reason":null,"comments":6,"closed_at":null,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487","labels":[{"default":true,"color":"ee0701","name":"bug","description":null,"id":406365144,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/bug","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWw0MDYzNjUxNDQ="},{"default":false,"color":"cc4916","name":"security","description":"","id":1262076072,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/labels/security","node_id":"MDU6TGFiZWwxMjYyMDc2MDcy"}],"milestone":null,"events_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487/events","html_url":"https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487","reactions":{"confused":0,"-1":0,"total_count":1,"+1":1,"rocket":0,"hooray":0,"eyes":0,"url":"https://api.github.com/repos/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/issues/487/reactions","laugh":0,"heart":0},"assignee":null,"user":{"gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/gists{/gist_id}","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/repos","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/following{/other_user}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/starred{/owner}{/repo}","login":"Lonzak","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/followers","type":"User","url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/subscriptions","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/Lonzak/received_events","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1830174? template.endText();\r\n 10));\r\nwriter.addAnnotation( annotation );\r\n```\r\nI wrote to Adobe User Group asking how may I get rid of the yellow sticky note. Their answer is below. Do you know how may I implement their recomandation in OpenPDF ?\r\n\r\n-------\r\nTry reducing the opacity of them. Or you can instead use the highlighter tool. That will make the text show through the highlight without being obscured. You can also reduce the opacity of the highlight, as well as change to a different color. \r\n\r\n\r\nBut if you really want to still use the sticky note tool, there is a free script to change  sticky note size. It's written to enlarge the size, but can probably be easily adapted to reduce the size. contents of the last cell (on the old page) in the new cell on the next page.\r\n\r\n**Example**\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34773412/67080750-27679900-f196-11e9-82bc-bd445e931b8d.png)\r\n\r\n**Logic with iText**\r\n\r\nWith the iText library this logic is fairly easy to implement because they provide an event which is getting called when the table drawing logic performs a table-split. That means, i can subscribe to the \"afterSplitTable\" table-event and do my logic (see also [iText: afterSplitTable](https://api.itextpdf.com/iText5/5.5.9/com/itextpdf/text/pdf/PdfPTableEventAfterSplit.html) ).\r\n\r\n**Question**\r\n\r\nDo you have any idea / tip for me how i can achive this behaviour with OpenPDF? :39Z","title":"Code Convention and Style Guide","body":"OpenPDF had till 2019-10-12 no Coding Convention or Style guide. And the formatting of the code is really a mess. \r\n\r\nSo from now on, please use our Style Guide for Java code. This is a very short modification of the Google Guide for Java code: https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html\r\n\r\nThe differences are only:\r\n**Indentation by 4 spaces, Continuation by 8 spaces**. This way there should be not much reformatting in the project.\r\n\r\nFor IntelliJ:\r\n**https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/blob/master/intellij-java-openpdf-style.xml**\r\nFor Eclipse:\r\nHelp 3. document.add(table2) -> this is not fit on 1 page, It's dynamic table.\r\nThe blank page is occurs on page 2. \r\nPage 1 -> table 1 (fits)\r\nPage 2 -> blank\r\nPage 3 -> table 2 \r\nPage 4 -> table 2 (continued).\r\n\r\nThe method addPTable, in looping create a newPage in the first loop.\r\n\r\n```\r\nwhile (true) {\r\n            ct.setSimpleColumn(indentLeft(), indentBottom(), indentRight(), indentTop() - currentHeight);\r\n            int status = ct.go();\r\n            if ((status & ColumnText.NO_MORE_TEXT) != 0) {\r\n                text.moveText(0, ct.getYLine() - indentTop() + currentHeight);\r\n                currentHeight = indentTop() - ct.getYLine();\r\n                break;\r\n            }\r\n            if (indentTop() - currentHeight == ct.getYLine())\r\n                ++loop;\r\n            else\r\n                loop = 0;\r\n            if (loop == 3) {\r\n                add(new Paragraph(\"ERROR: Infinite table loop\"));\r\n                break;\r\n            }\r\n            newPage();\r\n        }\r\n\r\n```\r\nThis probably correct if i didn't call newPage(), but if i didn't call a newPage() and table 2 fits on 1 page, Both table is not in separated page. Please give me a suggestion. \r\nShould this code changed when the first time loop won't create a new page object is missing or invalid","body":"There seems to be a bug with recompiling some pdfs: after just using PdfReader and writing with PdfStamper, opening the resulting output in Adobe reader outputs \"There was an error opening this document. The root object is missing or invalid.\"\r\n\r\nChecking the resulting file, the root object was referencing a non-existent object in the pdf. Checked and it might be because the original pdf had three Catalog objects, while the resulting pdf had one only, and it was referenced by the Info object.\r\n\r\nMy initial fix was to check that if the Info object was a Catalog type, the Root object would be referencing it; this fix worked, but I am not so sure since I am very inexperienced with pdf manipulation. Here is the [pull request](https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/142) but highly doubtful that it is a viable fix.\r\n\r\nSome notes:\r\n- The file was generated via Panasonic Image Capture Plus.\r\n- Using append mode for the stamper also fixes the issue, but looking for other to String.toLowerCase(), and friends should be checked for proper use of locales","body":"Case-folding is used for various pieces of data and metadata used in PDF syntax (perhaps also in user content). Those transformations are based on Adobe's general assumption of the use of US_ASCII/ISO-Latin-1 encoding. As noted in the comment on pull request https://github.com/LibrePDF/OpenPDF/pull/76 This fails for (at least) Turkish locales, where Capital I can fold to a non-Latin-1 lowercase dotless `i` (`ƒ±`).\r\n\r\nWhere PDF syntax is being processed the ROOT (no-language) locale should be used. Each case has to be examined, at least superficially, to determine if:\r\n\r\n1. the System locale should be use (_e.g._ for filenames)\r\n2. The ROOT local should be used, as discussed.\r\n3. A locale defined in the PDF itself needs to be used, as transformations are being performed on the content streams. (I do _not_ know for sure that there are any such cases at this CFF font subsetting does not work correctly.\r\n\r\nThe subsequent PDF output is broken in Acrobat, stating that the embedded font cannot be extracted. It does work in other readers, but I believe that is because they are more lenient than Acrobat on this issue, but unfortunately using another reader is not an option.\r\n\r\nI created a fork of OpenPDF and turned off font subsetting entirely and the output works fine, but obviously this is also not an real solution, because these fonts can be quite large and this particular font results in a minimum PDF size of 12MB, so the problem compounds when using multiple fonts.\r\n\r\nI inspected the PDF output with PDFBox's preflight and it errors with \"Font DICT invalid without \"Private\" entry\", which does indeed seem to point again to the subsetting being broken, not including a private section in each font dict, which would explain why Acrobat is falling over as well.\r\n\r\nI did Date());\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t// pass name of\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t// field\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\tpdfSigApp.setLayer2Text(\"Digitally Signed\" + \"\\nReason: \" + Font();\r\n\t\t//font.setColor(Color);\r\n\r\n\t\tfont.setSize(9);\r\n\t\tpdfSigApp.setLayer2Font(font);\r\n\t\t\r\n\r\n\t\tpdfSigApp.setLocation(signingHelper.getLocation());\r\n\t\t// pdfSigApp.set\r\n\t\tPdfSignature sigDic = new PdfSignature(PdfName.ADOBE_PPKMS, PdfName.ADBE_PKCS7_DETACHED);\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\tsigDic.put(PdfName.FT, PdfName.SIG);\r\n\t\tsigDic.setReason(signingHelper.getReason());\r\n\t\tsigDic.setLocation(signingHelper.getLocation());\r\n\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\tpdfSigApp.setCryptoDictionary(sigDic);\r\n\t\t------------------------------\r\n\t\tHashMap exclusions = new HashMap();\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\texclusions.put(PdfName.CONTENTS,new Integer(7622));  //== Here is problem how to  caclucate this Value ?\r\n\t\t\r\n\r\n\t\tpdfSigApp.preClose(exclusions);\r\n\t\tLOGGER.info(\"exclusions:\"+exclusions);\r\n\t\t\r\n\t\tString hashPdf = generateSha256HashInHexForPdf(pdfSigApp.getRangeStream());\r\n\r\n\t\t//sending this hash to external service for sining----geting pkcs7 signature in response..\r\n\t\t\t\t\r\n\t\t\tsigneddata = Base64.getDecoder().decode(pkcs7Signature);\r\n\t\t\t\r\n\t\t\tbyte out[] = new byte[signeddata.length];\r\n\t\t\tSystem.arraycopy(signeddata, 0, out, 0, signeddata.length);\r\n\t\t\tupdates.put(PdfName.CONTENTS, new PdfString(out).setHexWriting(true));\r\n\t\t\tpdfSigApp.close(updates);\r\n\t\t\t\r\n\t\t\treader.close();\r\n\t\t\tFileOutputStream
